review_text: The bp pulse electric charging service is the best in Portugal.

Normal rated fuel sold under a premium brand, that gives you no benefits. Want your car to work fine do the schedule maintenance in time or within the kms.
Plenty of cheaper fuel stations that sell certified fuel. Waste of money on placebo premium fuel. Anyone saying other wise is either being paid or just a bad mechanic
They sell fossil fuels and candy. Nice staff though.
GPL a bit expensive, but at least it's always open

Very friendly host.
He didn't speak English, but we were able to communicate with him using gestures.
Nice little caf√©.
Great service.
It's a very nice cafe with excellent service üëå the staff are wonderful, I recommend it without hesitation.

Great authentic places to have a wonderful time. We took Capuccino and double espresso long shot, chicken and cheese Coxinha de frango. It worth to try. There is a great advantage of the place if you are visiting the city with kind. There is perfectly protected kids playground just next to the cafe, so you can enjoy your coffee time and let your kids to enjoy themselves, too.

So happy that we found this place for an afternoon coffee break. First of all, it'd hard to find cafes offering soymilk in Portugal so I'm glad Brigs offers it. Friendly service, great coffee and unique sweets! We tried their version of ovos moles and another one filled with caramel textured. Both good! And good value. Highly recommend!
Very cozy and pleasant place with inspiring view and convenient for children. It offers nice coffee delicacies, petiscos, brigadeiros, past√©is and many other sweet and solty delights!
Nice little shop right by the Forum. Staff was super nice and helpful with suggestions. You must try the hot chocolate, so thick you can eat it with a spoon and absolutely delicious!
Great outdoor seating. Great service. A good place to sit down and relax if you need a break.

Very attentive and friendly staff, although a little slow. They are very helpful..! The place is a little dark and with only 3 seats to wait. The seats are very low for an elderly, disabled and/or pregnant person. I don't know how easily a person in a wheelchair could move around the premises.
Terrible customer service, unpleasant treatment. They make any business in this center tedious.

At night i am going bp and i am waiting 10 minutes front billing services but lady not come and after that  i ring the bell for please come but young lady very disrespectful and       Rudely speak with me she work night shift üëéüèª

It is in the center and the right next to my hotel , the waiter was very nice and welcoming , the food did not take long and it was really nice .
The octopus salad was really good , and the shrimp was delicious as well , the only comment i have is that the shrimp was not deveined and i had to clean it. But otherwise , satisfied with the service and the quality. Would visit again.

Possibly the best steak with cream mushroom sauce I have ever had. Service was exceptional. Great location. My friends had the vegetaruan pasta and the seafood mix with shrimp. They all raved about the experience.

While passing through Aveiro, we thought we'd grab something to eat. After a short walk through the city streets, we found this restaurant where we decided to stop for a bite to eat.We didn't have high expectations but we were pleasantly surprised ordering something basic from their menu of the day. Overall it was very tasty and cheap, worth trying if you're in a hurry and you don't have enough time to explore the city in search of the perfect restaurant

Food was not good. Stale chips, beef very undercooked(asked for medium rare got barely rare)

Waitress and waiter were very nice but very understaffed and took a long time.

Very overpriced when comparing quality of food and drinks to similar restaurants in the city.

Postive note: cool patio and had heaters for a chillier than usual night.

We had lunch here and chose the daily special.  I had the cod casserole-type dish, cod with cream, and my husband had the duck rice.  Both meals were delicious and the special included bread, two glasses of wine.  We also ordered dessert and my husband had an espresso.  All included it was less than ‚Ç¨30.  Great deal!  Service was friendly and efficient.  Highly recommend!
Everything was so delicious and fresh. Im not the biggest fan of mussels, but id eat this one again no problem. I already miss the food.
Very good place to eat fresh sea food ! Ver good service and a pretty nice quality price. Good wine. Card payment was not possible the day we were there.
The Croquette de carne was so hard to eat, way too expensive for something local. they fried it way too long. It didn‚Äòt taste good, i had to flush it with the San Miguel beer.

We stopped here for the oysters.
Food (mussels and oysters) were very good and fresh.
Service, one of the worse ever met.
We waited 50 minutes to have 3 oysters (and 35 for the mussels), we repeated 3 times that we were waiting for the oysters and after "yes yes, immediately "and 50 minutes, we had them (very good and fresh). Moreover, when we asked the bill they brought the wrong table, and then at the end they told that is ONLY CASH, no credit card. So pay attention Especially for the bad bad service.
The oysters and clams were very delicious!

We stopped here for a quick bite to eat on the patio after our moliceiro boat tour. We got the ham and cheese sandwich and it was exactly what we needed to finish our quick day trip here in aveiro. Thank you

We had an amazing time! Pedro was so kind and let us take our time asking questions about the drinks and food. We had a delicious cheese and meat board and enjoyed our refreshing drinks! Pedro is passionate about what he does and gave us personal recommendations!

We had a great time at Salicornia! The bartenders were amazing and accommodating of our group. The drinks tasted great the accommodations had the perfect atmosphere for enjoying beer and drinks in the afternoon/evening.
Great place with friendly bartenders. We came as a large group and they were accomodating. Only took cash while we were there. Stayed there for a bit and they gave us a shot free of charge.

Absolute must if you are in Aveiro!
We came to try the local seaweed beer but we're out of season, instead got to try the local seaweed raw, learnt more about the town than any tour guide could tell us and we're in the most wonderful setting! An absolute must tavern! Staff were brilliant, thank you for hosting us

The waitresses were really weird. When we sat down they told us to stand up so they can prep the table. After 10 minutes we said that instead of 22 people tables we actually want 12 people and they said that they close now (we were not informed beforehand, it was 15:30 and it supposedly closed at 15:30 but it was full) and they prepped the table just for us and they are making an exception. Anyway we all sat down (22ppl) since we did not have time to go somewhere else. I was in a table of 7 and we had ordered a salad and since we had ordered 7 dishes (including a salad) they thought we were done and almost left. They also said that their steak is like a happy meal (???). Most of the waiters did not know English so it was hard to communicate.

Group of four waiting almost 20 minutes for tables to be cleared after a waiter told us his ‚Äûfriend‚Äú would do it. We sat down and all waiters ignored us. After we got up the table got cleaned almost instantly. Seems they don‚Äôt want to make money.

During covid.... don‚Äôt even think about it! If you‚Äôre not a Portuguese citizen (1) and don‚Äôt have a vaccine certificate done in Portugal (2) they WILL NOT accept you eating at their restaurant. Their customer service was appalling. You try have a reasonable conversation about how your antigen test is valid and they walk away from the conversation then come after you, calling you mad! Glad we did not contribute to their soon-to-fail business! If I could give negative stars I would.
Meat undercooked, and a funnily tasting fish soup.. Chips were Home made though.
I simply loved it. Best value for money I found in Aveiro.

It's a forty minutes walk away (3km) from Aveiro, everything stinks and smell like humidity. If you want to feel like a chicken in a box, well that's the right place for you. No hot water anywhere and you have to take your hygeinic paper everywhere because there is none in the bathroom. Leaving this place and I'm relieved. The beds are comfortable i guess and the people are nice. At least, it was not expensive...

I give him two stars for the backyard and the good attitude of the employees of the place, but they are the worst three nights of my life in a hostel, the notice put a separate room, and as an independent it had nothing, apart from the fact that it looks like a cage for chickens, the walls are made of wood and only 1.80 meters high, and to complete they have rented a group of boys who do not know the word respect, at one in the morning talking on the phone, listening to videos, hitting things, breaking bags made of plastic, eating their soup and other foods with very strong smells in a space designed to sleep, and above all you ask them to please respect and care nothing what you say.  Definitely the worst thing that ever happened to me.
Fairly ok for overnight stay, in low price!!  The atmosphere inside feels very good to me!  I think you will like it too!
I really enjoyed. The place is quiet, clean and organized. A very good option to young groups.
Friendly treatment from the waitresses, everything delicious!

Simply fantastic! ü§©üêüü¶Ä
It‚Äôs worth visiting Aveiro just for this restaurant. We took a day trip from Porto and decided to eat here spontaneously. Even without a reservation, we got a table for an hour and a half. The stuffed sapateira and the grilled sea bass were simply incredible, and the rice that came with the fish was excellent too, full of mussels and shrimp, perfectly cooked and bursting with flavour.

The service was also extremely friendly, fun, and welcoming, which made the experience even more special. They showed us the fresh catch of the day and asked us our preferences. And to top it off, the price is unbeatable for the quality of the food and service. A truly great experience!

Great place with amazing sea food. I do advise to book for dinner in advance. Preferably go for dinner around 20:00. Service personnel were very accommodating, active in reservation (called us the moment the space freed up for us earlier than original reservation time).
The soup, stir-fried vegetables, and grilled fish were truly memorable. The stir-fried vegetables, in particular, were the best I had in Portugal. The staff were also very friendly and welcoming.
Came in hungry. Left with a happy belly. üòä got the last table and they are turning people away, so that's lucky.

Amazing meal! The mixed platter for 2 (110‚Ç¨) was plenty for my very hungry family of 4, next time we would also order 4 seafood soups (best in the world, dairy free). Freshly weighed before cooking, I wouldn‚Äôt mind heading there from Porto to sit at the bar in the back. Our total was 140‚Ç¨, including wine, a steak, 2 soups, moules. We could barely eat dinner, this meal was so good and plentiful.
I had Tripas de Chocolate Crocante and it was fantastic! Very fluffy and soft, not too sweet, just delicious. Would come back!
The attendant was very friendly. I really enjoyed the food.
They have combo for tripas, drink and coffee. Great food ambience.

This is literally the best tripa you will ever eat, it doesn‚Äôt compare to any other places you will eat. The Nutella one is a must and I eat every time I go to Aveiro haha. They also have salty options and the decoration is amazing to look while you are waiting or eating.
Very delicious tripa and the interior is very beautiful and unique.

An iconic building that you can easily notice while you are driving or walking. It is located near the river. It is one of language school in Aveiro. The school seems quite big enough. You need to wear a mask before entering the school. They provide some benches to sit in front of the school. There is a beautiful garden too in front of it.
We didn't see the inside, but the facade is quite pretty.
Beautiful building does not go unnoticed.
Food is tasty but seems overpriced for the portions of meat. Service and ambience is good.

Amazing infusion of flavours and quite different from the flavours in Australia.  So nice to have access to Asian food after completing the Camino Frances and eating Spanish food. Well done owner of this
business!
Excellent restaurant for Asian! Pretty authentic taste and flavour. We really enjoyed our dinner here. Very good service too!
Excellent food & service. I've eaten here 3 times on my visit to Aveiro. Highly recommend

A ten-star restaurant!
The food was spectacular. We ordered the Veggie Gua Bao, Pad Thai, and Tahu Goreng Kacang. All the dishes were delicious, but the rice was on another level. We then chose two desserts, Chuoi Chung and Kue Lapis Legit, both very different, which made them even more special.
The decor is tastefully done.
The service was impeccable. Everyone was more friendly and professional than the last.
The bathroom was very clean, which speaks volumes about the restaurant itself.
Perfect, we'll be back!
Nothing out of this world
The fish display on the balcony of tourist center is really nice presentation of Aveiro.
Helpful staff,  able to speak in many languages.  Plenty of useful information,  as to be expected  but not sure how much is 'sponsored ' or 'genuinely unbiased '.

First of all, take the correct entrance.
When we asked for a map of the city we got one.
Inside the building we could cool down for a moment, which was nice at the moment.

The building looks so unique and cute b cause of the fish. You can find more information about tourism in the office. It is located near the river. The location is very easy to reach by walking. You can walk and enjoy the view.

This is probably the best service I‚Äôve received in a long time! Wonderful woman behind the desk - made me want to go see stuff I would have never done if it wasn‚Äôt for her enthusiasm and level of service ‚ù§Ô∏è

Housed in a building dating back to 1915, this museum is a participatory space dedicated to preserving and sharing the urban memory of Aveiro. Exhibitions are curated around the experiences and records of local residents, creating a deeply personal and community-focused narrative. Though modest in size, the museum offers thoughtfully curated content with meaningful depth. Above all, the staff are known for their exceptional friendliness and hospitality, enhancing the visitor experience.
‚Äª Included in Aveiro Museum Pass.
Really like the immersion audio experience. The staffs are friendly and pretty cheap to go to know more about the city
Basic history of Aveiro which would only appeal to those who are really interested. Very little to see here unfortunately. I had allocated an hour but I was in and out in 10 minutes.
Beautiful looking building that was fully refurbished inside and now serves as the city museum.
Small museum without so much content. The collection is poor but the explanations are quite ok. A place to go if it‚Äôs raining outside and you want to know more about the city.

This is the go-to place for trying the traditional Aveiro pastries made with "ovos moles".

They have a great variety of products. All made in-house and super fresh.

And, although they look the same, each has its own texture and flavor, which makes it worth trying them all.

You can notice the difference in quality when compared with pre-packed products available in other stores.

And they've been doing this for 56 years now.

Stopped in here to try ovos moles but ended up buying a whole lot more as everything looked so tasty and it definitely was. We tried 6 different things and each one was very well made. I only wish we could have gone back for more! Well priced given the quality and amount on offer.
we tried the ovos moles here (traditional dessert from Aveiro). I personally didn‚Äôt fall in love for it, but the shop is busy, lots of locals buying the pastries and the coffee is good too!
Had good ovo moles and a cake at this establishment - rather delicious pastries.
The Best One !
You should visit when go on a trip here.

I received a defective item bought on this store and they denied to replace it without a purchase receipt, even though it was a gift and it was the very next day.
I‚Äôve probably bought over a hundred euros of items there before, so it‚Äôs a shame that they lost a customer over a 2‚Ç¨ item
My favorite place . They have so many cute stuff. If you're planning to get a present for someone and you don't know where to go you should go to this place! you will definitely find something

place_name: Talho, Charcutaria, Mercearia e Produtos Regionais, JL
review_text: I didn't like the boss, we felt like we were pissing him off, not cool,

place_name: Talho, Charcutaria, Mercearia e Produtos Regionais, JL
review_text: I highly recommend it.

Boat is ok, the tour is the usual tour.
The quality of the guidance is not really good.
They say ‚Äú we will tell you about aveiro‚Äù, they just said this is the old part and this is the new part while just putting more and more people on your boat. Didn‚Äôt explain or feel like they know or want you to know about the town‚Ä¶
Perfect professional and funny guide in our boat cruise in beautiful Aveiro canals. Price 20.- euro worth it.

Nice walk through the canals of Aveiro where the guide gives you information during the tour in different languages... it's best to do it first thing in the morning... Since as the hours go by, you have to wait longer to get on and more people go by gondola.
An interesting gondola ride through the canals. During the ride, the guide provides many explanations, also in English.
Out of business üòî
A boat ride and buying salt at the salt mine are essential.
He is no longer there.
I got a few things here most of the prices are the same but the lady was so nice so I was happy with the gifts that I got

Beautiful souvenirs, made in Portugal, not in China üòÅ
The lady in the shop is very friendly, helpful, and patient.
It's a shame there's no online shop, because I'd love to reorder the beautiful socks from Meia Mania.
Bought: bags with azulejos motifs, various socks, and a knitted poncho.
I paid 20 euros, but the man kept insisting that I only paid 10! After protesting for a while, I finally got my change.
Poor guides. Never engaged with our side of the boat once. Would not recommend at all

07-08-2025
I wanted to share my partner's experience of a cruise in Aveiro. It was a beautiful and pleasant trip, something I'd already experienced several times... not with this company, and yesterday, what a disappointment!!!
‚Ç¨15 for a boat ride led by a grumpy captain who seemed "at the end of his rope," a guide (who wasn't one! Always on her phone, chatting with her daughter, or reading some explanations given once they'd reached the stop...) with zero involvement!! No respect for the passengers who paid what I already found to be a substantial amount, as they turned around in the canal before reaching the end, as other companies did...
One passenger even dozed off a bit... what an atmosphere! A disgrace for the company...

Avoid!! Avoid this company!

Choose another one, even if you have to wait a little longer (the availability of early departures should have alerted me). This boat trip is beautiful when you are in a friendly environment with a committed guide and people who respect tourists... but not this one!
An excellent experience. The guys who took us were wonderful and made us have a great time with their jokes and dancing. They also let our two German Shepherds accompany us on the tour at no cost.
I loved the food and especially the teque√±os with their garlic sauce were delicious! üòÑ
EXCELLENT ATTENTION, KINDNESS, SERVICE AND FOOD, THANK YOU VERY MUCH
A simple but good caf√© to spend some time and chat because it's very calm.
Frendly and efficient staff. The food is delicious and reasonably priced.
Nice people and good grill!

No comment.
Let me start by saying that we couldn't take off our jackets because it was so cold, they don't speak English (but I can understand that), we ate fish that probably would have been better if it had been raw, and it was mostly cold!!
Too bad, we were hoping to find a traditional place outside the chaos of the city center.

The waitress was super friendly! We arrived 40 minutes before closing time (without knowing it), and the waitress served us without losing her smile. The food was very good. The truth is, the other staff gave us very sour looks because of the time, and that gesture didn't make a very good impression.

The pizzeria takes you back in time. Mom makes the pizzas herself, and takeout was only available.
I ended up getting two delicious pizzas with my hands and feet, and my mom didn't appreciate the tip :) Highly recommended! Even though you might think, "Is this really good?" when you walk in, you'll be surprised!

place_name: Digidente, Lda. Cl√≠nica M√©dico Dent√°ria de Fermentelos
review_text: Excellent professional, with dedicated patient care....
Great laundry service where you can have your clothes or even carpets washed, which is quite important. They are very responsible and can arrange pick-up or drop-off services.
Impeccable service. Welcoming.
Awesome high viewpoint over Pateira park.
Unusual and somewhat abandoned place... but beautiful view from above!
Very nice breakfast
Warm and very friendly. I recommend.

I was really worried after reading all these bad reviews, but I went there... and the most sweet man was working there. Even though he did not understand a lot of english, we managed to understand each other perfectly. I had my passport ready, had to fill out a form ( he did not even take my passport, just the filled out form). After 2 hours I returned the bike and he greeted me with a wide smile on his face. Such a great service and such a nice way to explore the city for free! Loved it! Obrigada!

Impossible to use, there's no one at the booth, direction provided is to download app, however unable to unlock the bike.
When customer service is called, they only speak Portugese, that's fine, however as tourist, no help will be received.
I saw some people on the road with the bike, not sure how they did it, but many of the locked bikes looks brand new with lots of spider webs on them
You can rent a bike here for 2hrs max. for free, the staff is friendly, only need you to fill in a form with your passport details and will give the form back to you once you return the bike.
Extremely unfriendly guy renting out the bikes, didn't speak any English and didn't want to help at all. Bikes can only be rented for 2 hours and used in the city centre only
Great way to explore the town and surroundings. You can get 2h free bikes and super easy to get by your ID or passport details. Friendly and helpful staff. Thank you a lot :)

The best food I had in Portugal, a truly hidden gem. Great service, super nice staff to talk to, short waiting time, and good prices for the amount and quality of food you are getting.
This is a must-try!

I enjoyed a small dinner at the place: Octopus Salad and bread and it was fantastic! The salad was so tasty! Also the owner spoke no English but tried to assist my finding the closest ATM (they accept only cash!). Once I came back there was also a waiter that could take my order in English. It was a bit sad to sit inside during summer but totally worth it! It would love to come back one day.

Fantastic family restaurant! The food and wine are excellent! Diego and his parents are very kind and attentive! If you want to eat home-style quality food in Aveiro, come and eat here!
Thank you for the delicious dinners and fantastic hospitality!
Bori&Gabor from Hungary
Great, authentic Portuguese cuisine, excellent service and extremely nice owners

Nice homemade food:
We went 3 times to eat here during the weekend, as we were working in the area.
They have several options of meat and fish dishes, served in big portions.
The service attention is simply excellent, and the restaurant have a family atmosphere.
The only thing is that the plates are served only of rice or chips.
The best option would be Steak to stone, or Cod.
Great studios in a fantastic and quiet place in a very central part of the city. Everything is new and proper and very secure! I'm definitely going back !

New apartments, a large bathroom with a wonderful shower, comfortable beds, and super clean. Not to mention the location right in the center and, above all, Tiago's kindness. We can't be more grateful for all his attention. 100% recommended place. We'll definitely be back.
Thanks for everything, Tiago.
Very clean, very complete and central apartment, yet in a quiet neighborhood. 100% recommended, close to the canal to go on the boats.
A++++++++ professional. Recommended!!
Go as a client, leave as a friend

Discovered a bit by chance but mainly thanks to an acquaintance Ra√∫l who gave me this address... I have never had such a neat cut as that day and unfortunately I was not able to fully enjoy it because I had another appointment behind and my session was therefore shortened. It was my first cut in Portugal and I was delighted! Great professional. I will come back to "Man in Blues" the next time I am in Aveiro.
I happened to be passing by and immediately got an appointment for the next day. A very nice and competent men's barber whom I can only recommend.
He said he'd wait 20 minutes, after half an hour of fiddling around with no end in sight. But he went.

Great lunch with coworkers! Typical portuguese restaurant with nice vibes and great atmosphere! One of the waiters was nice, not much the other, but the service was great. I ordered slow-braised beef cheeks and were nicely cooked and tasty! As dessert, I ordered moist chocolate cake, and it was amazing!
The wine list is not so vast, but it has good quality ones for several range prices. A great experience üëç

Last night marked my second visit to this remarkable restaurant in Aveiro, and it was just as exceptional as the first. As a vegetarian, finding restaurants that cater thoughtfully to plant-based diets can be a challenge, but this place not only meets expectations‚Äîit exceeds them.
From the first bite to the last, every dish was a celebration of flavor and creativity. The chef, Ricardo, takes immense pride in his craft, and it shows in every detail. The ingredients are locally sourced, offering a unique taste of the region that you won‚Äôt find elsewhere. Each plate is a testament to his dedication to quality and authenticity.
What truly sets this restaurant apart is the warmth and hospitality. Ricardo treats every guest like family, making you feel as though you‚Äôre dining in his own home. His passion for Portuguese cuisine shines through in every interaction and every dish.
If you‚Äôre in Aveiro, this restaurant is an absolute must-visit‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre a vegetarian or a carnivore. It‚Äôs a culinary experience that beautifully blends tradition, innovation, and heart. I can‚Äôt wait to return!

Beat every restaurant in Porto. I didn‚Äôt expect the food to be so delicious in Aveiro. The creamy shrimp rice was phenomenal. The flavor is extremely rich and fresh. The dessert surprised me as well. I would recommend you to pay a visit here. You won‚Äôt be disappointed!
The food is very delicious. Definitely recommend üëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª

Very cute restaurant and the food is amazing quality for the price! Had the lunch menu plus dessert which was 15.50‚Ç¨ in total. The waitress was lovely and service was really speedy. Highly recommend
This place holds various shows and concerts nearly every weekend and can be a great cultural addition to the standard surf-beach-bar programm;)
Amazing theater! Beautiful place, very kind team and good program! 5 stars
A small but nice theatre. All covid precautions in place and enforced. The seats were well spaced but not the most comfortable.
Beautiful theatre in the city centre, celebrating 140 years old this year, completely renovated, with a great variety of theatre, dance and music shows.
Good for theater and concerts, bad for movies. The space is wonderful, the only problem is the cinema part, which doesn't have the needed quality.
Good Academy for learning with cool teacher who was kind and helpful, my course was in portugese language but Teacher translated in English that was amazing. Thanks for Academia Genios Livres.
I have good experience here with great staff thank you much more üôå‚ù§Ô∏èüáÆüá≥üáµüáπ

Highly recommend!
I saw Ines for a top up while I was in Aveiro and I was truly touched by her warmth, humor, professionalism and skill! I am very happy with my experience and my results! 10/10
I was in Aveiro briefly and I needed a dressing on an injury on my leg changed. Excellent service from the lovely nurse and great English! Was very lucky to find this facility
I recommend Dr. Ines to those who looking for a good esthetician. Professionalism, common sense and experience. The girls at the reception are very kind and try to help you with anything.
Fabulous! I live in London and every time I visit aveiro I go for a facial at Clinique. Highly recommended. Professional, clean, pleasant, knowledgeable staff. Thank you
Very friendly, very kind and very professional staff! Very clean, kind and calming atmosphere.

Two beautiful viewpoints that provide panoramic views over this big lake.
It is located in Parque de Espinhel, in √Ågueda, which is an integral part of the famous Pateira de Fermentelos, which is the largest natural lake in the Iberian Peninsula.
beautiful place, excellent for those who like to take pictures
This place is amazing they make sure you get one on one customer service, fresh food great prices. Will go back again for sure when I visit Portugal.

Very good restaurant in the area. Maybe the best one. They make very good meat and fish for an affordable price. Nice people and service. The owner, the Chef, have the attention to talk to everyone in the end of the service. A nice touch very well appreciated
Delicious Fish Festival dish! Huge variety and quality. Good place for week days as it is usually crowded on weekends.
Went on the weekend for dinner, not busy, ordered the veal and it was very tasty and not overdone,  staff were attentive and fast.

Surprising this place is no where near water but famous for their seafood.
A secret place away from any tourist

Very friendly service, pleasant atmosphere as it is a small coffee practically no tourists which makes it even more charming.

It can be a bit noisy as it is located on a main road, but there is plenty of free parking.

place_name: Area de Servi√ßo Autocaravanas - Autohome service beach
review_text: Lovely site to stay at with all water facilities, good sized well maintained pitches , close to the beach accessed along the boardwalk through the lovely sand dunes . There is a cafe adjacent to the site as well as cold showers and toilets . 30 minute walk into the town area from here , this is a good place to base yourself for a while , ‚Ç¨5 per night paid at the thr machine on entry .

place_name: Area de Servi√ßo Autocaravanas - Autohome service beach
review_text: Great place to base yourself for a long time . Do close to the beach , just a stroll away and a longish walk into the town along the boardwalk or by the road. There are showers across the road beside the bar/cafe as well as toilets attached to the cafe . Water refilling and disposal on site also .

place_name: Area de Servi√ßo Autocaravanas - Autohome service beach
review_text: Very efficient and well located site near to bars and restaurants

place_name: Area de Servi√ßo Autocaravanas - Autohome service beach
review_text: Parking is good but water is now disconnected.

place_name: Area de Servi√ßo Autocaravanas - Autohome service beach
review_text: A place to park near a spectacular beach and town. The area itself is quite basic. You have to pay to collect water, but not to empty either gray or black sewage. There's a parking lot next door where you can also spend the night, but you can't expand your space with tables, chairs, and the like. So, for 5 euros, we preferred to set up the whole Nativity scene and be safe from fines (signs already warn against overnight parking, although you'll later see they don't strictly enforce this). The location of the area is unbeatable. Spectacular beach. There are free cold showers and restrooms at a beach bar opposite the RV area, which you can use.

Absolutely beautiful seafood restaraunt right off the water of Aviero / Costa Nova.

The owner seated us and was very friendly. They helped us pick out some nice wines to pair with the meal and we got some of the best seafood I‚Äôve had in my life. The octopus was cooked perfectly and not the least bit rubbery, it was almost soft and pillowy in your mouth. The prawn was gushing with flavors and was so fresh. The clams had the simplest sauce to simply intensify the natural amazing flavor. And of course, we tried all of the deserts, and they were all to die for. Also, I believe the Sous Chef served our food and was able to answer some questions we had about the meal.

This was one of those truly rare 11/10 dining experiences. The service, ambiance, and food were all literally perfect. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough!

Me and my partner are vegetarian and were passing by this restaurant saw that they have one vegetarian option so decided to eat there but when the vegetarian plate arrived it was very little portion for what they we have paid. Meal was fried rice with little lentils (18‚Ç¨) it‚Äôs too much to pay for what we eat. I think the can improve the vegetarian meal.
Service and atmosphere were great! The fish was nicely cooked, but i think the sea soup lacked a bit in the seasoning part... It was too mild for my liking and not as rich as i expected!

Great food, an amazing service and the environment was just right.

The appetizers were super, and although the wait for the ‚Äúmassada de garoupa‚Äù was bit more then I anticipated it was well worth the time.

The ‚Äúmedalh√µes de novinho‚Äù was heavenly.

The deserts‚Ä¶. They are must, especially the cookie cake with soft eggs, my goodness just amazing

The service was impeccable. Theatrical yet genuine. If that makes sense. I would say hands down the best service IN the Aveiro area. Everyone that came to our table from greeting, ordering, food presentation, & delivery all had such great service it felt like they had some kind of special training. The fish was fresh and grilled almost to perfection (i prefer a slightly more charred & chewy texture for my red snapper). However, my husband agreed the texture of the fish was quite consistent throughout the entire body of the fish. O and the cookie cake is fabulously naughty!
Great experience. Ate way too much, but the cakes were too delicious not to. Fun experience in an authentic, inexpensive pastry shop. Highly recommend the chocolate cherry cake.

Absolutely disgusting experience! We went in for lunch, thinking a place full of locals must be good. Big mistake.

First, my husband needed the restroom, but a rude, power-tripping cleaning lady blocked both the men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs toilets, making us wait 15 unbearable minutes for no reason.

Then came the food‚Äîawful soup, mediocre pastries, nothing special. But the worst part? The change they gave us. Look at the photo. Moldy, torn, unusable bills! NO ONE accepts them. When I asked for proper money, the cashier just shrugged and refused.

This place has zero respect for customers‚Äîespecially tourists. If you value your time, money, and dignity, stay far away!

Bad and slow service, staff seeming extremely lazy. We waited for 40 minutes until we got fed up and asked where our food was and just then we got served by a different waiter, and we didn't even get what we ordered. The original waiter we had was a guy named Gonzalo, probably the entitled son of the boss.

The ladies inside running the bakery are sweet, through.

Really impressed with my chicken burger .. 4 stars only because I'd have preferred a crunchy roll rather than a soft one, but that's personal preference. The fries were crispy, fresh and tasty.. Great service.. very fast and friendly.

I'm sorry that nowadays the service is not able to apologize.
After asking what is the soup of a day i received the answer that it is vegetable soup. I ordered it.

Immediately after it was placed on the table I smelled meat. Afer asking if it comes with meat the answer was, yes it does, with sausage. I said that unfortunately I don't eat meat and I won't eat the soup.

Of course I had to pay for it in the end without any apology. I understand that I should have checked before ordering whether the vegetable soup by any chance contains meat ... I don't understand that the situation was not resolved in any way and that I didn't even deserve an apology for not being offered any other option or any: "we are sorry for uncomplete information" "we are sorry that we didnt try to understand client's side"....whatever would be accepted and would made one feel kinda let's say heard or seen.

For me a no go

The apartment very clean, comfortable, lots of light also due to modern finishing.  we had everything one could wish for a carefree stay.  In the radius from 10 meters you already have several shops and restaurants.  Bakery around the corner, fish market, etc. Beautiful beach is a 10-minute walk away.  beautiful hiking trails.  On arrival we were personally welcomed by Paulo, very sympathetic and friendly person.  He gave us all useful tips regarding the area and facilities.  I totally recommend Terrazzos and will be back without a doubt!
üîù Top

Local accommodation apartments with a wonderful location. They have the lake in front and the ocean behind them.
Nearby are the market, excellent restaurants, a bakery, a pedestrian promenade, parks, parking, and shops... everything you need for a pleasant stay.
The apartments are fully equipped, have large terraces with great views, and the staff is very friendly.
The apartment is very nice, spacious, and you can cook. There are shops nearby for shopping.

We stayed for a week in July 2024. A fantastic apartment in a perfect location. With a terrace, views of the estuary, and very well-equipped. It's about a 5-10 minute walk from the beach (a large inlet), surrounded by good restaurants, and easy parking (at least in July). Paulo gave us some great recommendations for places to visit, bars, and restaurants. It's wonderful to walk along the beach or its walkways. It's also not usually that stifling heat we've been suffering from in the Iberian Peninsula these past summers. It's 15 minutes from Aveiro. I also recommend visiting the chapel, museum, and shop at Vista Alegre. A place to come back again. However, I recommend always staying on Costa Nova beach. We found Barra beach to be overcrowded.

We went to the ‚Äúone ATM‚Äù in town to get cash because the restaurant we had already eaten at informed us when we tried to pay that they only took cash. This ATM didn‚Äôt have any cash, apparently. We were freaking out! There‚Äôs another ATM at the pharmacy a minute away, but it doesn‚Äôt appear on google maps.

Great location. The staff is friendly and helpful. Decent size room. The AC didn‚Äôt work, thankfully, I was able to open the window. Unfortunately they put me in a room without the ocean view. Pretty clean space. The breakfast was pretty good.

Amazing stay in an amazing locale. The hotel looks unassuming from the outside, but it's modern and gorgeous inside! I booked a superior room and I'm glad I did - I could have spent the whole trip out on that beautiful balcony overlooking the lighthouse and the beach. Breathtaking! The room was well thought out from the desk to the sitting bench to the closets to the huge bathroom with plenty of towels and towel hooks. The staff were also incredibly kind. Everyone interacted with there was friendly and went out of their way to help me. They were fantastic English speakers. I'm already dreaming about my next trip! I wouldn't stay anywhere else in the area

I am making the review covering it by parts: 1. Accessibility, place, the local area.
1.Acessibilty- Easy access by car through highways "A25" and "EN's" (nationals), no fuss, parking wise you can find lots of public spaces on roads nearby.
2. Cozy room(3rd floor), safe locker, mini bar, lots of space, we requested a baby bed and the space was suitable for it. Bed  mattress queen size, WC with bathtub, hairdryer, and make up mirror.
3. We went in January to this place, so low season regarding occupancy and we notice that at night some restaurants and bars were open and with some medium attendance so expect high season to be quite crowdy.
Extra note: the view to the lighthouse and seaside was amazing.

My family and me stayed here for 2 nights. The location is perfect, in front of the Farol square with a breathtaking view overlooking the sea. We had two rooms categories, one was a refurbished suite on the 3rd floor, the other wasn't and lacked modernization and air conditioning. Breakfast was great, wifi had good consistent signal everywhere in the hotel. Staff was polite but not very helpful in providing touristic information. The beach is just a few steps away.

The location, the views, the room size and the great breakfast make up for all the small details that it's lacking (like good door locks). It's very clean. Pay the extra 10‚Ç¨ to get the superior room. You will get a nice balcony and a lot of space!

Don‚Äôt go there. The maracuja caipirinha tasted like rum mixed with water, we asked to change it 3 times and they just added more sugar. We didn‚Äôt want to pay for it and didn‚Äôt drink it but the bar manager insisted that we had to pay. Never had such a bad cocktail in my whole life and very unfriendly staff.

We had good experience with the food. And ask for americano or a large coffee if you wanna get a regular coffee, otherwise you get a strong but small portion (as everywhere in that area). You can have more sorts of coffee with milk, cream etc. From snacks we had sandwiches and burgers, all was tasty. Not much English despite they are located at the hotel.

Don't eat the pastries. The natas were burnt and a day old. Croissants also tasted stale.
Asked for different croissants and got the same burnt natas back.  Sometimes you just can't win. Maybe lunch is better.
Gorgeous place! Very nice staff. Absolute beautiful design. Paella is highly recommended! There are 3 types. We really felt at home here.

This location has great drinks! Must try the caipirinhas. They also serve food well past regular dinner hours which is perfect for late night snacks. The only downside is that service can be slow and inattentive at times.

TOP! Finally found a hairdresser 5 minutes from my house that I can truly say is professional in all aspects. Catarina knows what she is doing! From coloring to cutting and styling, she is confident in her profession. Her salon is modern and her team are also very welcoming. I felt comfortable while there and confident when I walked out! Thank you üòä
Service is super good.
Bom material !
Delicious dinner and favorite meal in ilhavo, casual atmosphere, very friendly owner and staff - we will come back next time we are nearby! Maybe one day it will be a restaurant in NYC :)

Great local place!
For 14 euros you get a grill mix for 2ppl
With salad french fries and rice
Of course it's not like the brazilian all you can eat churrascos but nice and good if you like meat.
Still serves food at 10:30pm
And the deserts: home made ! And just delicious
The owner knows how to make a mousse au chocolat or a nata
Very good. Beef excellent with a taste of garlic....spicy sauce very good!!!
if you like good food and a friendly place, it's the restaurant to choose in Ilhavo.
Delicious food 5/5!
Paulo is awesome! He is very professional and nice!
Very friendly staff and excellent service
Excellent service thanks

I wish i could give a lower review than this, the way the treat people is unbelievably they think they breathe a different air then us mortals, opening an account with them is hell i went there 4 times had to wait 1h and each time they ask me for something different that i need to bring just because ‚Äúi am not portuguese‚Äù ‚Ä¶ it can‚Äôt get worse than that hope you learn to be human and help people instead and work on your service to treat people more respectfully.

Ordered fried chicken dish with salad and fries and halfway through the dish I discovered that the chicken was completely raw under the fried breading!!! Disgusting and potentially dangerous food - keep away!

Terrible, I only don't give it zero stars because it isn't possible.

The guy at the bar didn't speak perceptible Portuguese. Colleagues of mine saw fricking cockroaches near the food and never set foot in this place again. Parking is a nightmare. Lunch were some slices of pizza that, well, they weren't bad but they won't be winning any awards either.
Very good food and pleasant services
Delicious! Ate everything and regretted nothing!

Aldi √çlhavo is a great supermarket with a wide selection of products. It offers not only everyday essentials but also a variety of international items, which makes shopping there interesting and convenient. The store is well-organized, and it's easy to find what you need. Prices are affordable, and the quality of products is generally very good. I especially appreciate the weekly special offers and unique products from different countries. Highly recommended for both locals and visitors.

Another supermarket chain. They have some unique products and some reasonable prices. As with all shopping it pays to shop around if you have the time and inclination.
We found the best priced as well as the purest coconut milk here, in the same can!
Recently opened and nice to shop at

Great accommodation! I stayed there for 10 nights and I highly recommend it! Ideally located, very clean, fully equipped, and comfortable! The balcony is a huge plus that I loved!
Marisa is very kind and attentive!

Totally stylish and equipped house to live there, in the kitchen you have everything you need to make breakfast, lunch and dinner, clothesline, washing machine, refrigerator ... Ideal place to sleep, large room with wardrobe, large and comfortable bed, pillows with little body, the place is run by very friendly people, the cleanliness of the place stands out, quiet to sleep, for all this I give it 5 stars, the only "snag", but that does not make me take away any stars, is that inside the rooms, there is no service or bathroom, you have to share it with the rest of the rented rooms, I do not take away any stars, although this has not been comfortable for me, since I am forced to get up at night several times but you will find two fully equipped bathrooms with a shower, one larger than the other, totally comfortable thanks to its space and its sliding doors.
It feels like a family, the rooms have a shared bathroom and are quiet. Very clean.
Very polite and very nice staff
Great location and fast/efficient service.  I parked, was the first one served and was on my way.
Good place to leave the car and very well maintained.
Parking spaces are available along the promenade. There is also a space for electric vehicles.

place_name: Bus Stop Costa Nova to Aveiro
review_text: Bus stop at costa nova. Price to Aveiro is 2.80‚Ç¨ per person. Space for luggages. If there‚Äòs lots of traffic, therr are delays. In offseason, no delays and enough space.

place_name: Bus Stop Costa Nova to Aveiro
review_text: 45 minutes delay! They don't care about their own schedules, at all! If you are in a hurry because you need to take a train or bus in Aveiro, DO NO TRUST THEM, better take a taxi.

place_name: Bus Stop Costa Nova to Aveiro
review_text: Service with unreliable schedules. Fare ‚Ç¨2.50. Costa Nova is nice.

place_name: Bus Stop Costa Nova to Aveiro
review_text: He is not punctual at all, he can easily arrive half an hour late.

place_name: Bus Stop Costa Nova to Aveiro
review_text: Absolutely unreliable service. 30 minutes late, and that's not during rush hour. Even in the morning, the bus is already late. If I could, I wouldn't give it a star.
Free public bathroom. No toilet seats for men's or women's but there was toilet paper and paper towels. Also signs for free wi-fi but I didn't check it.
What the point of opibloc toilet if  its locked. Had to take a piss in the door

N√£o se preocupe! Don't worry! The lady in the morning said as we peeked into the bathroom, although we didn't know why we should worry. It was funny because we thought there was a step toilet, but no, it was only for 1 person and it was occupied. Very clean and free, thank you very much. The lady in the afternoon was also very nice.
There's only one toilet, but it's super clean! The women's bathroom door doesn't lock, so the cleaner sits outside and keeps other people from coming in. LOL
Closed Sunday 17:30 p.m.

Very nice restaurant with amazing service and tasty food. Seafood rice is delicious. The cod was a bit boring. Prawn starter was amazing. The waitress was super friendly and upbeat. Prices are normal for area.
Very cozy and delicious food. You will spend like 20‚Ç¨ p.p. This fried shrimp was very tasty and the rice and calamari was well served.
Great place. The girl that attends is very friendly. The rice with bacalao is very good. Recommended.

Great food and lovely decor. The recommended dessert : "Lambadinha" was amazing. (Show as the front one in the picture).
Also many people in the reviews are saying you can't pay by card, but I paid by card today just fine.

Great food. Best fish soup I've ever had. Shared the cod rice, cleared the dish, super tasty and moorish. Nice bottle of wine, very affordable. Good service, nice people just lost a star for atmosphere as it was late Feb and empty. Shame. Would go back in a heart beat. Thank you guys!
Clean and with paper but without toilet seats. Everything else in good condition
Opens at 0:700, closes at 19:00. Pretty clean in the morning, toilet paper and soap have been present. I think all you can ask for a public toilet.
Clean, for free

The shop is small but adorable, although not as adorable as the lovely ladies who serve you. It's full of lovely things at more than reasonable prices. I went there today with my oldest daughter; I'll definitely be back before I return to Barcelona.

place_name: Restaurante Clube De Vela da Costa Nova
review_text:
The food was incredible, and the price matched the quality of the meal.
However, the service was awful. I know it‚Äôs a touristy place with a lot of people, but PLEASE ‚Äî if you know you can‚Äôt properly take care of your customers, don‚Äôt welcome them and don‚Äôt make them wait for hours outside the restaurant.
I felt the stress of the waiters and didn‚Äôt feel comfortable at all.

place_name: Restaurante Clube De Vela da Costa Nova
review_text: Stopped for an early light lunch on a weekday, so the place was very quiet. I had the prawn risotto which was amazing ‚Äì flavoursome and cooked to perfection. The person greeting people on their way in was a bit stern-looking, but once inside the wait staff were very friendly and attentive, without being overbearing. Sitting outside watching egrets chasing each other around on the nearby docks and boats, enjoying the food ‚Äì the experience was great. Recommended!

place_name: Restaurante Clube De Vela da Costa Nova
review_text: Lovely place where you can enjoy great food over de Canal. Excellent service and great atmosphere.  Local fresh fish and seafood with a good list of wines.

place_name: Restaurante Clube De Vela da Costa Nova
review_text: The place is beautiful and the food tasted wonderful. However, the service was too touchy feely with me. I ordinarily don't mind a handshake, a gentle pat on the shoulder, but this was a shoulder grab and squeeze, the type I would expect from a friend or a partner, followed by a couple of intentional grabs of my forearm. The service was also too slow. The food may have tasted great but had me sick after I walked out of the restaurant with food poisoning, which ruined the rest of my weekend. I had some oysters and grilled octopus.

place_name: Restaurante Clube De Vela da Costa Nova
review_text:
Not friendly waiter.
Initially he told us we need like 30 minutes to wait to be seated.
When we agreed he told us it‚Äôs 45 minutes wait time. We also agreed. After that he told us there is 60? or 16? people in queue (we haven‚Äôt see anyone). Absolutely unfriendly and he definitely doesn‚Äôt want us to eat at this restaurant
It's very beautiful restaurant, nice service and very delicious. Grilled octopus and seafood rice are very good.

Not s√≥ good as sailing club or sailing school

The club conditions are okay but The quality and knowledge of real sailing
Is very far from what it h√°s, they just CARE about The Kids of friends and from friends of friends....

Start was to good to be true
Amazing waiter at the door, informed us for options to get the table in about 1hour and we accept it, there was a line of the local people with reservations, so we decided it‚Äôs a good sign ü§ûüèº
At the same moment we got a complimentary proseco, garlic bread and potatos frios (but cold ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è) we ordered oysters and they bring it to us it was fantasticüëåüèº positive and good vibes
(Oysters was ok, usually we fight who gonna get last, now we fight who gonna eat last:)
After 30 min we where invited to the table
My octopus grilled with with migas and potatoes looked so promising‚Ä¶
But at the end was one of the worth in Portugal (till now it was fifth this trip)
My lovely wife ordered cot and it was good, nothing to add, just good
Staff is nice and friendly
But don‚Äôt think i will ever back in there or recommend this one

Hope u will get better luck üôèüèº

Food is great but service is questionable, with no menus in English and very overpriced with hidden fees (which I found by using Google translate). Staff also managed to give me a wrong bill 3 times more expensive than what we bought. Not recommended.
Service was bad , forgot one of our entries and we were just two people . We ordered the cattle fish and it was fried and very greasy. Will not come back.

Fabulous little place.  Great range of essentials.  They sell plant based milk and loads of dried beans too.  I even found large (not fine) porridge oats üëç Very friendly and speak excellent English.

Family run business with great selection and service.  They are a grocery store, hardware store, liquor store and more.  I thought we might need to head into town for better selection but this place seemed to have it all.  You need gluten free products? They have them.  Fresh Produce? Yup.  You don‚Äôt speak Portuguese? No problem, the older and young staff can switch to English.
Nice neighborhood market with a wide variety of goods.
A very small shop, but you can find basic groceries and much more. Very friendly staff.

A solid choice for seafood lovers when you are in the area. This was our second visit. The sea bass we had on our first visit was the best we've ever had. The second time around, we went with their recommendation and we really enjoyed the grouper. The octopus salad was also well made. We'll definitely return on our next visit to Aveiro. Reservations are highly recommended during the high season.
We went here for my birthday.  The service was fantastic.  We enjoyed the food. We had previously gone afew years ago. We will definitely go again .

One of the best seafood restaurants in the world
Must try the seafood rice and grilled seabass
Very good restaurant with good crab and fish soap. Design is modern and service is good. Can easily recommend it.

4.6 I recommend eating at Dori and making a reservation in advance.
The food was great with generous portions. I would recommend the Lenguado and the octopus salad.

The atmosphere was good and the waiter was nice.
We were celebrating a birthday so we requested a special dessert but they forgot about it. They also switched up the meat doneness. Besides that everything was great.
A bit expensive but ok.

Absolutely fantastic restaurant with meaty and fishy meals, ever some vegetarian options. Simple and delicious. I highly recommend Codfish a bras, that was a real delight. The burgers and sandwiches also looked pretty great. They might not be light meals but are still served with nice salad of fresh vegetables, so that's also a plus.

Amazing little place, just opened a couple of months ago. Great burgers, steak sandwiches and other food, all with a Madeiran twist for very low prices. I actually think it is almost too cheap for the quality you get. They also serve the local beer of Madeira, Coral.
You can also shop for wines, Port and other things.

We visited this restaurant during our trip to Aveiro and unfortunately got food poisoning from the seafood we had there on May 1st. That day, we only ate "Camar√µes ao Alho" and "lapas grelhadas" at this restaurant and nothing else at all. A few hours later, we started vomiting and had severe diarrhea. It took several days and medication to recover. It was a very unpleasant and disappointing experience.
Simply but honest local food! Fresh and tasty! Highly recommend
No taste, no air condition. There are more several good places in Costa nova

It's a pretty good coffee place, and not very crowded. It's self-service and has ice cream.

Note: Cash only.

I do not recommend this restaurant to anybody. The service was atrocious. The restaurant is supposed to open at 12 pm but it only actually opened closer to 12:15 pm. We were a table of 4 people and we sat down in the terrace at the same time as the people at four other tables. After waiting for nearly 10 minutes, I had to wave the waitress over to tell her we were ready to order as she had essentially ignored us up until then. She was unpleasant and looked very disinterested by us. She had already gone to all the other tables to take their orders. By the time we ordered, one of the other tables had already received their food and drinks. Incredibly, after repeating our order to us to ensure she didn‚Äôt miss anything, she forgot to place an order for the plate of sardines ordered by my mother. Of course, she only realized this 45 minutes later. Meanwhile, the dish for my wife and I, which had a 30 minute preparation time, arrived after almost 45 minutes. The other tables on the terrace had already finished their lunch and paid their bills. I told the waitress that the service was a disgrace but she could not have cared less. The staff did not even try to smooth things over by offering a discount or a free item in the house. I‚Äôve grown accustomed to average service at bars and restaurants but the service we experienced here was unacceptable.
It was very good. Would recommend
Good price. Testy food. Big portions. Good service. 5/5
Relaxing quite quaint. Great prices. Very generous servings. The sea bream was super fresh. The waitress was lovely.
Perfect lunch, great sea food, fish are excellent. Highly recommended
Did the store exist 25-30 years ago? I think I bought picture frames for my children üòç
Very good service

Fantastic concept, floating sunglasses... You never have to worry again, when swimming in the sea.

Others are made completely of recycled material. Very sustainable stuff here.

Also a friendly agent that helps you to find the perfect sunglass match.

Amazing restaurant. I ate gooseneck barnacle for the first time here (May 2025). It‚Äôs unforgettable experience, and I like it. We ordered a lot of seafood stuff, overall it‚Äôs incredibly fresh, Paella seafood and Grilled Sardines are my favorite ‚ù§Ô∏è. They cook really well, so we mark this restaurant that has to visit again next time we go to Portugal.üáµüáπ

If you are focused only on very good Portuguese food, this is your place! I was not so happy with the service as it was not so polite for me. But when the food came I forget everything. It was the best bacalhau I had in Portugal. It was grilled bacalhau. Extremely tasty. 5/5 for food!
The only disappointment was gooseneck barnacles which I anticipated the most in but seafood rice was divine.
Traditional Portuguese food and atmosphere.  Fresh fish in abundance.  Good service and price. Went back after first visit.

I have questions, why this place has high rating?
First of all, service is snail-slowüêå.
And you wait long to get seated.
Food - starters were good, but came barely warm. Mains - disaster.
Also it‚Äôs super loud inside, you can‚Äôt talk.
Probably slowness is due to lack of staff, but food quality can not be  excused.
And it‚Äôs not cheap.
I think better options can be found around there.
We were passing by this town and got negative sediment because on this place.

A beautiful small hotel (villa with 3 floors and several rooms) located on the "beach promondory" of the Costa Nova" near Aveiro. You need to choose a room (at a higher price) with a sea view (this means an inner bay, not the open ocean) - these rooms are larger with a big balcony and the view is much nicer than the opposite rooms facing the street.  The rooms facing to the street are also very small. The ocean view also allows you to see flocks of flamingos with binoculars or a cell phone etc. The surroundings are very nice, cute typical Portuguese colorful striped houses, long promenade along them and along the sea. Right next to the hoel is an excellent fish restaurant, fruit/vegetable shop and market with fish, other goodies, cheese, wine, olives pastries and of course a fish restaurant upstairs, pharmacy and big parking place. The beach - open ocean - is a few minutes walk away. The beaches are gorgeous - long stretches of wild, sandy, but manicured beaches, with restaurants where you can watch amazing sunsets while having a carafe of sangria. By car it's a few minutes to the centre of Aveiro and the university, but there is a bus service too. Breakfast is possible in the detached building of the hotel, where there is also a reception with 24 h-service (about 50 m from the hotel villa). The cleaning is precise. Overall, I definitely recommend the hotel - we spent a little over a week here as part of a business trip (scientific conference at the university) and a shorter holiday.
Wonderful place and lovely staff! Highly recommended
Great experience, great location.

The place is perfectly located right on the promenade along the estuary, and the beach is just three blocks behind the hotel. There's a seafood restaurant as you walk out the door and several shops on the same sidewalk. On the same street, there are several more restaurants, shops, and a convenience store. We had breakfast at the hotel and it was good, but the best part was the service from the hotel staff. They were impressive, very pleasant, friendly, and professional. The room has a double bed, air conditioning, a large closet, a safe, a small terrace with chairs, and a large bathroom with a bathtub. A very quiet place to relax.
Worst place ever if you see the old lady working there just run. It‚Äôs better to walk a little bit she hate everybody, even if you talk good with her she‚Äôs gonna end making your day horrible
Bad service

Terrible rooms. Like a very small wooden shoe box. No tea/ coffee making facilities in rooms.  Paper cups in bathroom for drinking water.   Breakfast very basic and underwhelming I would not go back or recommend
Great for a short stay. The shower door would not close all the way, but everything apart from that in the room was okay. The brealfast could use a better coffee, for which you had to pay extra.
Very basic hotel, beds are terrible, both me and my husband are aching. There's no bar open, two young girls on reception are pleasant but not very helpful.

Amazing location!!! Parking we just did the free street parking across from the hotel.
Very friendly staff. The room was decent size but the shower was super small & the bed was rock solid, but does the trick.
Breakfast was basic but did the trick.

Beautiful hotel in the heart of Costa Nova. The room was super clean and breakfast was excellent.  Location is perfect, and there is free parking available right by the hotel.  Only about a 10 minute drive from Barra beach but you can walk to Costa Nova Beach. Definitely would stay here again!
Large portions, very good but sweet! You can also order a simple waffle or crepe without toppings.

Absolutely delicious waffles, crepes and astounding variety of deserts.
Friendly staff, great service all round.
Wonderful location right next to the
famous lighthouse.
Very tasty ice-creams. Friendly service.

We left the place 45 minutes after ordering an Ice Coffee and a Hot Chocolate wich we never saw. 2 tables were attended before our arrival and were served before uss. We questioned the waitress who didn't even know what to say, and didn't apologize.
Nothing else to say...
Delicious! A lot of flavors to choose from. Very friendly and attentive staff. Family member has a peanut allergy, they took the time to check ingredients.

place_name: Pra√ßa de Taxis da Praia da Barra
review_text:
We preordered for an early morning pickup at costa nova, no one came and after a 2nd call they hung up and did not pick up.

Do not recommend if you need reliability.

place_name: Pra√ßa de Taxis da Praia da Barra
review_text:
POOR service! After a 15-minute delay, I called back 5 times and they didn't answer (I have a Swiss number...). Then I had a Portuguese guy call and they answered right away! Terrible! I waited 45
minutes instead of 7!

place_name: Pra√ßa de Taxis da Praia da Barra
review_text: A woman makes you wait 50 minutes at night, then finally answers the phone, and when you ask where the taxi is, she hangs up. Zero stars, I've never experienced anything so rude!

Excellent location. Just cross the street to the beach. Private individual parking,
which is appreciated in an area with limited parking.
The cleanliness and amenities are far above average.
Very friendly and constant contact.
100% recommended.
Extraordinary. Clean, well-located, and excellent service.
Everything amazing
Excellent bread, breakfast and cakes. One, if not the best local bakery in Aveiro. Highly recommend.

I came to have my nails done twice by Erika while I was in Aveiro in 1 month. I was only passing through for the holidays so unfortunately I will not be coming back but Erika is very gentle and very professional! Fast and well done work... practitioners in Portugal are often slow and hurt your hands. Here, the work is very well done and the price is really affordable! Good luck. Lola.
Excellent service and impeccable work. It's worth letting yourself be pampered by the wonderful hands of this professional. 100% recommended.

It's not just because she's my sister, but she's a wonderful person in every way. She does her work with all her love, passion, and care. Anyone who goes to her won't regret it, I assure you. üíÖüíï

This is my go to place to do my eyebrows. Though, last time I went it was to have my facial done with Fatima and it was beyond relaxing and helpful. I strongly recomend this place ran by these great working women.

It's my favorite place when it comes to pampering myself. The best are Idalina on my nails, Angelica on my eyebrows, and last but not least Maria, who leaves my hair beautiful. They are the best. I recommend them. üëç
Excellent beauty and massage center. The service is excellent. 100% recommended.
I really like your work and I hope you can grow much more, 100% recommendedü´∂üèª

I have only made two small purchases here, to replace a watch battery, but the service is incredibly kind and professional. The next time I am looking for some lovely jewelry this is the only place I will consider shopping. It says a lot when people make someone spending so little feel so valued.

I love this place and visit every time I go to this plaza.  You get your plate, a drink and a ticket for coffee.  How could you go wrong with the quality and price.

I liked it because it's "fast" food, but real food, something I miss in Spain. The meats on the menu were good (pork and picanha). The portions were very large, so the price is very good, and it also includes a drink and coffee. You can't ask for more for ‚Ç¨8-9. The staff were very kind, because I asked to change rice for salad, and they accepted it without a problem. Thank you ü§óü§óü§ó

Very bad behaviour of the Lady with the other people. We dined in the restaurant but they gave us a plastic spoon. When I ask for the spoon her behaviour is very bad and rude to us. I will not recommend it to any other community to dine there. Thanks

Good pizza, friendly staff. Easy to locate.
Affordable. Ingredients are fresh and high quality. They use fresh mushrooms and not pre-sliced from a can like so many places.
Pizza dough comes thin and well cooked, better than Pizza Hut. One pizza had something a bit weird, it tasted like cream, maybe the cheese was not the mozzarella we are used to.

I have eaten here multiple times and enjoyed the food but yesterday while I was eating I found a blue thread baked into the pizza dough. The staff refused to give us a refund which makes me think twice about purchasing food from there again. I am disappointed.

I ordered a pizza a few weeks ago.
It was really nice, the price was a little high.
Anyway, really recommend.
Everything on the menu is great
Top

Friendly service but to see anyone or to do anything it takes minimum 45 minutes regardless of the issue.  This place does not a operate like a bank branch or station, this place operates more like head office. There are 8-12 people working but maybe 2-3 of them actually serve people and at incredibly slow rate.   The bank does not prioritize the efficient movement and service of customers.

I have never spent less than 45 minutes for anything here.

Will be closing my account and trying a different bank.

For everyone that wants the best guys in performance consultant, this is it!

Everyone is so warming and kind.

Amazing team!
We love the staff at this farmacia. Jessica and Leonor and all the others are so helpful and kind and take such good care of us.

Excellent service, although my lack of Portuguese. The owner did her best to serve me with a vegan dish based on tofu, although not on the menu.
It's a big place, the prices are reasonable..

If you want Chinese food make sure you see Chinese people actually eating in that restaurant. I always get the picante soup (sour spicy soup) and the Peking duck and it‚Äôs always delish! Officially the best Asian restaurant in Averio. They have some off the menu items (beef spicy noodle) & this spicy dish (on the Chinese menu) that comes with pork, beef, or fish and I have to say it‚Äôs the best thing they make there! I forgot I was in Portugal for a bit. And order the Chinese bread (steamed not fried!) for your little one and it‚Äôll be a big hit!
Excellent! The best Chinese in Aveiro. The staff are super friendly with kids and you cannot beat their lunch menu during the week.
Very very delectable! Very good service. The staff was very kind and accommodating. Cozy atmosphere.

The best Chinese restaurant in Aveiro. The service is fast and the staff is very heartwarming and nice.
The food is very good.
Choose the wine wisely tho, we had a bottle not ok, but the staff changed it immediately with no added costs and apologized. Crowdy but not full and not expensive. Less than 20‚Ç¨ per person eating and drinking well.

scam pharmacy i have placed an order i received 4 emails confirming my payment with order details,no updates on the order for a month, they dont give you a tracking n. and also dont reply to emails or phone calls despite the fact they have an email and phone n. on their website . and don't send you the parcel .
Professionals at their work, definitely recommend them.

place_name: Dinastia - Padaria e Pastelaria - Prato do dia
review_text: This is a good place to have a nice breakfast or a snack, mostly they offer quite good "cachitos" and "folhados" of course a bunch of different kinds of breads, natural fruit juice, good coffee, delicious teas, many other beverages and very good treats for the sweet lovers. They got a good location right on front a shopping mall, a pretty good environment and they always have a great and very kind staff

place_name: Dinastia - Padaria e Pastelaria - Prato do dia
review_text: I like the patio seating area. The coffee here (especially gal√£o) is very good. The torrada needs a bit more butter and salt, but the biju bread is great.

review_text: Good bakery and great cakes. Everything's fresh and prices are reasonable.

Great coffee and a big variety of pastry. The service was also very helpful to foreigners and tourists. Definitely recommended although a bit away from the city centre.
A bit too sweet. With too much sugar added.

It‚Äôs ok,  but it‚Äôs not authentic Venezuelan. The cachitos had a little ham inside and the rest was puro pan.  The service is quick and they are helpful but it‚Äôs not Venezuelan. They need to change their name
Quality wise  is top notch, one of the best bakery's in Aveiro.

And for a good photo section, we have this wonderful place üòä üì∑üì∏üñºÔ∏è

This cafe is right on the water with sitting inside and outside. Someone suggested I try their Pastel da Nata. And I can tell you that it was indeed one of the best I have ever had.
The pastry was nice and crisp, almost like a very good croissant, very flaky. The custard was just right with almost perfect sweetness.
If you are traveling on Portugal coast and happen to be around Aveiro area, you must visit this small cafe.
I also asked for cafe com leite to be extra hot and it was indeed that. Most places it is like warm, so if you ask for they will make it.
The breeze is nice and cool and the cafe is awesome. Overall 5 star.

I was really looking forward to trying this ice cream gelato place at Costa Nova beach, but unfortunately, the service was terrible and the ice cream was subpar. I wanted to try two flavors, but the attendant only allowed me to taste one! When I asked for two scoops in a waffle cone, she said no, and it took her colleague's help to finally understand my request. Even then, she seemed unsure and told me the cones were the same, which wasn't true. I ended up giving up on the second scoop and just paid for one. With so many other options around, I'd say skip this place and move on.

Highly recommended!
Great, thanks.

Highly recommended! The team is amazing! I‚Äôm still learning Portuguese, but they were very patient and understanding throughout. They helped us unblock a sewage drain, fix our shutters, replace the shutter cords and replace our old wall sockets at an affordable price. Everything was done efficiently. It‚Äôs such a relief to find people who are both helpful and kind. Muito obrigada!

The staff is amazing! I am still learning Portuguese, so I often have to wait for an English-speaking employee. We needed parts for irrigation system that uses 40mm pipe, and they had the elbow/knee connectors. They did not have the pipe, but gave us the name of another hardware store to ask, AND they had the pipe!!  This staff is amazing, and drogarias in Portugal are great.

I got my best leit√£o ever.

This is a real traditional Portuguese family restaurant.

You only get one dish :

The famous Leit√£o served with homemade chips and salad.

The meat was tender and their crust was crispy. Only delicious.

They have a huge wine card from all regions of the country.

Don't forget to book your table at least one month in advance, otherwise you will not get a free table.

The leitao was perfect but the service, and bad attitude of the personnel was not good nor inviting.
A restaurant can have the best food but if the service isn‚Äôt good and personnel is rude and ignorant. Pretending not to understand even when spoken in their same language, then I would not recommend it to anyone. Great Leit√£o. If you want to taste it, go there and you will have the best one in Portugal. Authentic place, very good quality food and great and gentle staff. Even if I do not like pork, it was a good experience and worthy trying it. Will return for sure. Recommended!

Omg so delicious!!! One of the most decadent meals I‚Äôve had in Aveiro hands down. First off I ordered 4 different things off the menu: get the arepa Pabellon with plantains, meat, cheese, & beans with the most perfect crunchy & soft bun! And the pancake (chchapa de queijo ) with Venezuelan cheese is the perfect sweet & savory. (YES this is for very evolved palettes that can distinguish and appreciate different flavors all at once) SO not for everyone. The taquenhos were a bit salty. The Empanada was crispy & chewy. This is comfort food at its best for when you do not want to leave your space and you need to pig out.

We had lunch as part of a tour group, and everything went like clockwork. My travel companion and I both had the pork cheeks with mashed potatoes. After some initial squeamishness, we were blown away. So tender, with a delicate pepper spice. The potatoes were the perfect consistency in the very light pepper gravy. If there was anything I missed, it would be a side of vegetables to round out the meat and potatoes. Dessert was a choice of salted caramel chocolate.cake or a fruit salad and both received kudos from our group.
We were with a tour group so it was loud. I am sure that most days it would not be as busy. The food was excellent and so was the service.

place_name: Feedback Institute, Escola de L√≠nguas, Centro de Estudos, Forma√ß√£o e Tradu√ß√µes
review_text:
I highly recommend this Feedback Institute to anyone seeking to learn a new language. It's not just a place of education; it's a place of personal growth, and connection.The teachers here are nothing short of amazing. They go beyond the traditional role of educators; they create an environment that feels more like a family than a school. Whether you opt for online or in-person classes, you're in for an incredible learning journey that you'll cherish for years to come.

I've been lucky enough to have Ondina as my English teacher over the years, and she's a real gem. She has the rare ability to make learning English not only easy, but also incredibly fun. Her passion for teaching is evident and her dedication to her students is truly commendable.

place_name: Feedback Institute, Escola de L√≠nguas, Centro de Estudos, Forma√ß√£o e Tradu√ß√µes

Today as I finished my course in Hair I can say I am confident to perform and work anywhere. This confidence I gained from VLCC Akurdi. Thank you
