review_text: Top

I have been taking English classes online for more than one year, and they have been going really well. We can do all the important parts: reading, listening, speaking and writing. The quality and profissionalismo of the teachers in preparing the classes are 5 stars.

Ah, the conversations we have are just amazing! We chat about everything from dissecting the latest Netflix series to diving deep into the meaning of life itself. There's no topic off-limits in her classroom. And let me tell you, the laughter that echoes through those halls when we're with her‚Äîit's like a symphony of joy, wiping away any hint of sadness. She's not just your average English teacher; Mary Silva is like a confidante, a supportive presence, and sometimes, she even plays the role of an informal therapist. Our talks range from the intricacies of literature to the complexities of existence, seamlessly blending deep discussions with light-hearted banter. It's incredible how effortlessly she helps me navigate through my teenage struggles and schoolwork. With her friendly smile and understanding eyes, even the most ordinary topics like grammar and syntax become fascinating. Who would've thought grammar could be so cool, right?
I love this school, I‚Äôm here since pre school. Love the teachers!!!!

place_name: SOS Obras Aveiro, pinturas, remodela√ß√µes, canalizador, capoto
review_text:
This company was very prompt in the beginning to inspect the problem and diagnose it.  They needed a part and asked for a 50% deposit for the job.  I agreed and they said it would be 2-3 weeks for the part to arrive.  I texted the technician after about a month and he said the part had not arrived. After 2 months later I tried to call the technician and no answer.  I then tried to contact the company and no response.  I finally got them to answer a text and they asked who had worked on the job.  Now another month has passed and I haven't been able to get anyone to answer my texts or calls.  I don't know what happened but they seem to have just quit doing business or something and I am out the deposit.

After the response to my original review, the only contact I have been able to get from them is to refute my review here.  I have sent multiple emails and texts to them but no response.  I am sure this was an honest mistake but they are not even trying to help me rectify it.  Just ignoring it is not good business.

Continuation of my review.  I finally after 3 months of calling, texting, and email got some to actually meet with me today.  It is kind of a raquete.  In most cases when everything goes well they probably do good work, but in case I think I finally understand what they are doing here.  It appears to be a message board for handymen to find jobs.  If they finish the job, everything is great.  In my case, it appears the man doing the job left town, probaby back in July, and now the owner and his salesman, I guess, just say not our problem, our names are not on any of your documents.  The only record that I am sure they have is my initial contact on their website, but like other website messengers I have used it did not send me a copy of my initial email.  So, I have learned, and if I could give them less than 1 star I would.  So, beware maybe other sites are better but I would stay far away from this one, and I still can't find their office in Aveiro.  It looks to me like it doesn't exist.

Although the outside looks a bit shabby, the inside is clean and tidy. Compared with the goods in the nearby large supermarkets, agricultural products here are of much higher quality. Very friendly shop owners and fair prices. Saturday is always busy

This is the market with the best selection of fruit and vegetables in town.
It is best to go early in the morning during weekends to take advantage of the great assortment of quality produce offered by small producers, always very fresh and mostly organic.

There is also a butcher shop  and a fish market with fresh seafood and good fish selection inside the market, so it is surely  worth  a visit to sort out your Sunday lunch with the freshest ingredients and support local producers.
Local farmers market, veggies, bread, fish.  Fresh!
Lovely place with lots of fresh vegetable, fruits and flowers for sale. Friendly merchants and good prices.
Good products but not many vendors. Needs more brightness

I'm giving it a poor rating due to the difficulty of paying:

- Apple Pay doesn't work
- credit card payment doesn't work
- payment possible only in cash and only with 5 or 10 euro notes => 20 euros. Too high, having to go back and get change... a shame in 2025!!! Maybe a way to get only cash!!!
Good, but the traffic is steep and not very well signposted.
Narrow entrances and small parking spaces, difficult for very large cars. Perfect location.

review_text:

Small and efficient. Reasonable parking most of the time. Good promotions and discounts. Not the best for vegetables, but all the rest has a good relation price vs quality.  Friendly staff

Good market, mainly best for pastry üç∞üç∞üç∞
Small and good grocery market
Convenient for the basics.
We had Tripa with cinnamon - absolutely delicious. Won‚Äòt be our last visit. üòâ
We loved the tripe here. Super fluffy, the chocolate delicious. A 10!

Yes, very tasty and a must-try. It's kind of like cr√™pes. We had them with chocolate. 2 euros each. The seller was extremely nice, and the hygiene was exemplary... I have no idea why I'm writing this. Go and eat it!!!!

SPECTACULAR!!!!
Not only for the taste but also for the price.
It's a pleasure to see a young person working with a smile, one after the other. If there's a line, it's for a reason.

We had such a great time here ‚Äì it‚Äôs so much more than just a place to stay. The whole vibe is special, almost like a playground for grown-ups. There are slacklines, all kinds of boards to try out, and of course the surf school. It‚Äôs the perfect spot to chill and soak it all in. Super relaxed atmosphere, a lovely team, and lots of optional trips and activities if you feel like exploring. The room itself is rustic, but fits perfectly with the laid-back spirit of the place. Definitely a unique and memorable experience ‚Äì we‚Äôll be back for sure!

Probably the best kitesurfing specific hotel I've visited. Matthias and the team have done an excellent job.  All the staff are super nice.  There is great food at the bar/restaurant. The breakfast is massive and delicious.  They have a BBQ every Saturday which is a must. Lots of kite gear to rent and storage for your own kite gear.  Moe and the team at the kite school so a great job of organising activities for non windy days like wakeboarding, surfing and skateboarding to name a few.  The place has a great friendly wibe and highly recommend it.

Matthias and Anna are the loveliest hosts we met. The place is incredible. If you love to meet people, enjoy musicians coming spontaneously, have an experience out of time, and obviously kitesurfing, this is THE place. They have the best kitespots, the best teachers, the best equipment and the best staff. You've all been so nice, thank you Luis, Melanie, Emma, Sergio (best dedicated teacher ever :)... Perfect match if you want to come with your boy or girlfriend, kite and visit Aveiro that is nearby. They are well equipped with funny toys (electric skates, bikes, training stuff), boats to take you to paradise for kitesurf lovers (and beginners) and dreams for this place.
We were there, loved it and plan to come back.
All the best, Anna and Matthias, you rock!!
Nice relaxed vibes, clean room with a nice bar onsite. Located in a rather industrial part - they‚Äôve managed to create a great space to hang and spend a night or two

Very cosy place and a wonderful service
Nice individual concept !!
Enjoyed very much our stay
A really kind coffee shop where you can practice your Portuguese with the lovely lady at front. Great views + great people. Stay awesome
Fresh cod pies and delicious coffee! Friendly hostess.
Small coffee shop

Beto is a skillful professional of the cut and trim arts. Your hair and beard are in good hands and you can always count on him to advise you on the best products to use at home. The barber shop is well located and there are plenty of parking spots around it. Reservation is advised. Trust & Go.
For years I've come to this place. Price is a little bit higher than normal in the region, but service is really the best around and staff is very nice.
Nice workers and fast and furious scissors. The best place in aveiro portugal to u cut ur hair.

On the route from Aveiro to Cernada de Vouga, there's a station called Erol. What's so special about it, you ask? The tunnel and storks, the Mouse Bridge, and the small river we'll cross are all worth checking out. If you're interested in riding Portugal's last narrow-gauge railway, be sure to check out this stop.
A good meeting place and passage for people, I like it,

A bit expensive for a small supermarket chain, it doesn't have a very wide option range of products and is quite tightly squeezed inside. Some aisles are impossible to walk through if more than 1 person is there. The staff is fast and efficient at their job.
Smal market but good

A restaurant that deserves more than the rating, very tender beef and a more than sufficient garnish, the owners come to see us several times to see if everything is going well, to do again.

A simple restaurant. The food was good and exceptionally reasonably priced. We paid ‚Ç¨47.50 for seven people, including wine, soup, salad, main course, and dessert, and it was all quite good. We were even allowed to turn off the TV.

Great food, Great service! Chill atsmosphere and near the park so the kids can play b4 and after a meal! Will be back! :)

Great local place to visit away from the touristic beachfront lager bars. Had Franziskaner and 4 Portuguese bottled ales, IPA, Stout and an American IPA. Good choice of burgers and friendly staff.

We had an excellent grilled chicken dinner served with wonderful homemade fries, rice, and salad. Finally, the dessert pudding was delicious! So congratulations and thank you for this delicious meal at a very reasonable price!!!
Every summer while I‚Äôm on my holiday time, Toc Toc became my best and convenient service!.. Love it!

I am very satisfied with the service offered by this company, TOC TOC DELIVERI. The punctuality and friendliness of the staff, and the care with which deliveries are handled, make all the difference. Everything arrives in perfect condition and on time. It's clear they take service quality and customer satisfaction seriously.
You feel welcome when you walk in. Love the bread, corn bread, pastries, atmosphere and friendly staff. Prices are competitive but the service stands out from other locals.

Very well-kept salon with very friendly and welcoming staff. The work is neat and done with care. The salon also offers hand treatments and some skincare products for sale at a reasonable price. You will have a good relaxing time here in addition to your treatment. I recommend it.

Me and my (Italian) wife saw this restaurant on the page of an influencer and decided to give it a try, also to see if it's really as Italian as they say it is. The restaurant is really well located, and you would think that because of the central location it would be overpriced, but it turned out to be not true. The staff was very professional and friendly, providing excellent service. Now to what matters the most, the food. I ordered the Pasta alla Forma and my wife had the Gnocchi ai 4 Formaggi. The gnocchi were really tasty, soft and the cheese tasted really good. We shared the dish and were left satisfied. As for what was supposed to be the star of the show, the pasta, we, personally, weren't too impressed. Not to say that it was badly done or tasted terrible, no, but it just did not meet our personal expectations and taste. I'm glad I tried it but it's not something I'd be ordering again. The portions were very good but the dishes were also heavy, so we finished everything with a bit of difficulty. We finished the meal with a Tiramisu, which was really soft and melted on the tongue. I usually don't like this dessert but the way it was done in this restaurant really impressed me. A pleasant experience over all.
Great Italian dishes and pleasant staff. Definitely recommend visiting this place if you like Italian food.
Great food and very polite staff. Location is also great! Would recommend.

The ravioli pasta was good, but the pizza was really bad in every way. I honestly don‚Äôt recommend the food.
The service was nice, but be aware ‚Äî whatever you ask for will cost extra.
I also ordered a tomato and arugula salad; it came with only four cherry tomatoes. When I asked for more, they charged me an extra ‚Ç¨2
just for more tomatoes!
3/10
Great place. Stopped for lunch. Loved cream of mushrooms soup and white sangria.
Vegetarian pizza was good. It's a different taste from other pizzas. Prices were not bad.

The so-called "endless" all-you-can-eat is a joke.
The selection is very limited, both for pizzas and drinks ‚Äî you‚Äôre allowed to choose just one drink for every two people.
As for the food, you can only order a new pizza after completely finishing the previous one, and then you have to wait all over again for it to be prepared.
The pizza itself is just okay at best.
It‚Äôs definitely not worth the so-called "rod√≠zio sem fim".
I‚Äôd recommend exploring other options.
Worst experience  very bad food quality..

AWFUL pizzeria. You‚Äôre better off heading to the freezer aisle and picking up a frozen pizza.  And to top it off the staff are unfriendly and rude. Instead of apologizing for forgetting one of our pies the cashier with the glasses caught an attitude and her response was ‚Äúsomething happened‚Äù. Great explanation! Maybe edible at 3 am after a night of drinking otherwise go literally anywhere else to eat!
The coffe break deal takes way too much time to come to the table.... Nice people, but too busy!

Located next to the Grand Canal, the best restaurants in town, and across from Aveiro's historical district, make this an ideal home base. The hosts are very responsive, referred us to the best local businesses, and they made our visit to Aveiro easy and fun.

As others pointed out, this is NOT a 2-bedroom place, but instead has 2 beds in the hallway, and 1 bedroom. That made it a very different experience for us, staying with 2 small kids, because we basically had to whisper all evening.

The kitchen is seriously lacking basics like even a chefs knife.

They have a sign up about "Leaving towels on the floor for replacement" but they don't actually do any service during a 3-night stay. We asked for more toilet paper and garbage disposal, and they fixed that, but didn't bother cleaning or restocking anything else...

Staying here as I write this review. A wonderful place to stay right in the heart of the action and alongside the canal. We have the double room option. One thing to remember, the second bedroom does not have a door so for long stays this may be an issue. The girl that checked us in was very nice and gave us loads of tips on what to do during our stay. There is a lovely Italian restaurant on the ground floor of the building and a pizza pizza place next door. There a list of eateries and bars within a 15 minute walk and most within 5 minutes. Aveiro is a beautiful place to visit. Enjoy while staying here.

Great appartment right on the canal's of  aveiro town - the venice of portugal.
A sail of gondola's start's on the street below and end's at the same place.
Good value and great location.
Very beautiful brand new apartment very good central location

Ordered the pepper steak, medium rare. It came out as rare. The fries are crispy and good. The other fishes looks nice, tasted some of the wings and mix grill, both of them were really tasty. Everything tasted nice, but the rare pepper steak was a dissapointment.
The food in this place is very good value for money. The quality and taste is great and the prices are decent. Highy recommend the beef steak with fries and egg and grilled octopus!
Great cozy place with great food and desserts. We had gambas with oil and garlic, fried calamari‚Äôs, maracuy√° cake & a dessert with chocolate, condensed milk and cream and it was marvelous!

It‚Äôs a very cozy place with an amazing atmosphere. The employees are super nice and welcoming. The food is superb, everything was mouthwatering amazing and definitely a repeat.

review_text: Extreme excellent service and good price!  Lunch special menu from 6-8 euro which includes soup, choice of main course and deserts. The price includes choice of red or white wine or bottle water. Highly recommended!

place_name: Restaurante Bella R√≠a - Prato do dia
review_text: Great menu do dia at Aveiro. Definitely recommended to try their different menus (it will included a drink, soup, meal, dessert, and a coffe).

place_name: Restaurante Bella R√≠a - Prato do dia
review_text: It was a big surprise to find this place in the touristy center of Aveiro! We were late for a regular Portuguese lunch time and were looking for a budget option. This cafe in the shopping center offers simple cheap meals. Who could believe that for 5‚Ç¨ one can get a "menu do dia" that includes soup, main dish (two options), drink, desert and a coffee. I had a Roasted chicken thigh which came with rice and salad and mousse de chocolate for desert. My partner chose Prego no prato (pork) from a 6‚Ç¨ menu.

place_name: Restaurante Bella R√≠a - Prato do dia
review_text: The ratio between price and quality is perfect. Cheap good food. Soup, dish of the day, dessert, wine/water, coffe ONLY 6‚Ç¨ !!! And great location, what more can you wish for :))

The cafe is at very excellent location on the canal in front of the Forum Mall. The staff here is very helpful and polite. We just happened to be here for a cup of coffee. The coffee was provided at a fast pace and there was enough time to enjoy the view and passing colourful Gondolas.

Not as good as the reviews suggest. Service without a smile. Cafe com lait was average, and a little cold. Standard Portuguese pastries. The caf√© c.200m down the road, on the street side (rather than canal side) is much better. Very friendly staff. Fresh cheese, breads, and a good range of homemade baked goods.

Nice and friendly owner. I can totally recommend it. It's also very close to the shopping mall.

They sell instant coffe as coffe. In a coffe shop

Don't come to this gas station. If you use a card from outside Portugal, they'll hold ‚Ç¨150 on your card for days (that is, if you manage to get it back). Plus, they don't even mention it anywhere. I think it's a completely abusive practice. If I don't have the hold lifted in a few days, I'll go to the police station to file a complaint.

the place is empty even the workers are not there I went with a group of people and we had to wait for the workers to finish smoking and hidding . The rodizzio buffete is not a buffete , they want you to eat whatever they want 2 pizzas for 4 people is a joke and the worker just wanted a reason for don‚Äôt work explaining the rules and being not nice with the customers , the only customers!!

The manager is very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere is kid friendly.
People so sweet and kind, great service and environment, and the selection of sweets and bread are incredibly tasty and with perfect fluffynes and crunchy, highly recommend!

I love this place! Very friendly staff, delicious food, and great prices. I‚Äôve always left this place feeling full and happy. I recommend having the hamburger, (best in the area) servings can definitely can be shared!
Not possible to pay via bank card, everything else is good

A good store with a large selection of fruits and vegetables! Reasonable prices.

We asked our bolacaha stand where the best piri piri chicken was and that‚Äôs how we ended up finding it and I have to say. It‚Äôs worth the wait. They take their time. Don‚Äôt forget to ask for extra piri piri sauce! It‚Äôs so delish! And the fries were so fresh and crispy on the outside soft on the inside.
Service was very quick and efficient. Food was excellent and reasonably priced. They do not bring a bill to the table, you simply go to the till to pay when you are done.

Came here to get their BBQ chicken and by far the best tasting and biggest one.  Also tried their grilled cod with potatoes and absolutely delicious!  Eat in or take out and the atmosphere is really nice and laid back.

Best Portuguese chicken and French fries I've had ( and I've eaten alot of chicken and fries in my life) nice casual atmosphere... great place to take your family to eat a satisfying meal. Very cool, I loved their personal charisma, very good people and pleasant music, also food and drinks, it was delicious.
Perfecto i strongly recommend to all travelers

Everything was great.

Great food, lovely coffee. TERRIBLE SERVICE. Patience is needed and time as well. Very unorganised. They really should invest A LOT MORE in Training their people!!!

Nice space, great deserts and service but it's a bit expensive and they don't give you a receipt for some reason, and if you ask for it that's when they actually insert the products on the machine. Kind of makes you question the maths.

This is honestly the best place to go for photos. The team is very professional, friendly, and makes sure you get the most out of your session. I highly recommend their services! My favorite place, I made there lips, removed tatuagem off my eyebrows, make my nails and laser depilation. All specialists are professionals, tools are sterile, service is top at very reasonable prices

This salon is absolutely the worst place I've had the opportunity to be in. There should be serious consideration about closing it down. There are significant doubts regarding the legality of this establishment's operations. The service was exceptionally rude ‚Äì the lady attending to my nails not only displayed a lack of gentleness but also ignored my requests. She attempted to explain her working method chaotically, conducting a monologue without allowing me to say anything. There was no color sample, and they persistently tried to convince me to get pink nails, which led me to give up on the full service there and compelled me to seek help elsewhere. The method of cutting nails after applying the polish was strange and improper. Even though the service was incomplete, it took an incredibly long time ‚Äì a whopping almost 3 hours. The studio was neglected, the equipment outdated, and the gel removal machine operated harshly and painfully. The end result left much to be desired ‚Äì the nails were uneven. Even a simple request not to cut the cuticles was met with a clear lack of respect, almost disdainful eye-rolling. My experience as a customer was definitely not treated with the appropriate respect.

I've visited the salon many times. It's very bright and cozy, with lovely staff.
Special thanks to manicurist Anna; her work has never chipped, broken, or otherwise damaged my nails. The quality of her work is always very high!
The salon's technicians speak Russian, Ukrainian, and Portuguese. They always offer coffee, tea, and sweets. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
I recommend her üíØ

Thank you for the professionalism: high quality, neat, easy, the feeling of me as a client and my preferences - it's all about the girls who work in this salon. The salon has a pleasant and friendly atmosphere and very nice staff!) I definitely recommend it and will be happy to contact you!!!

The ovos moles were beautifully made, and I even received a free cookie, which was a sweet surprise. The staff were friendly and welcoming, and everything felt very authentic and relaxed. Prices are fair, staff is friendly, and there are tables upstairs but no table service.
I liked everything here! Sweet and smiling staff, a huge selection of ovos moles in all kind of shapes and an elegant location... Highly recommended!

place_name: M1882 - Maria da Apresenta√ß√£o da Cruz, Herds.
review_text:
I had the pleasure of being taught by Maria how to make ovos moles, traditional Portuguese sweets, as part of a workshop for blind people.
Maria had already prepared the cream the proper way and brought it to our space. She showed us how to fill the wafer, how to cut it, how to join the two pieces to create the sweet, and how to trim the excess with scissors.
On the same day, we ordered lots of boxes of ovos moles to bring back with us to Greece. They were absolutely fresh.
Thank you for everything, Maria!

place_name: M1882 - Maria da Apresenta√ß√£o da Cruz, Herds.

The original station was opened in 1864 with the inauguration of the Linha do Norte (North Line). In 1916, the building underwent a major renovation, during which 59 azulejo panels were added to the fa√ßade. The tiles were designed by Lic√≠nio Pinto and Francisco Pereira and produced by the F√°brica da Fonte Nova. The tile panels follow a dual theme: those on the platform side introduce travel destinations, while those facing the city depict scenes of everyday life in Aveiro. Due to growing rail demand in the late 20th century, a new contemporary station building was added, while the old station has been preserved for its cultural and historical significance. Today, the station is served by Alfa Pendular, Intercidades, Regionais, and Porto Urban Trains, making it a key hub in Portugal‚Äôs rail network.
Current station is new and so so, but there's a smaller building nearby painted with beautiful azulejo tiles depicting scenes from Aveiro, including the boats and the salt.

The ancient train station is very beautiful, the wall fresco's tells a lot about the town and its history. The small shop that's inside the station got  all sorts of souvenirs. From local wines to specialty snakes.

place_name: Caixa Cr√©dito Agr√≠cola do Baixo Vouga, Ag√™ncia da MURTOSA
review_text: Always a warm welcome, even though it's not always easy for them since I still speak very little Portuguese. Thank you.
The coffee was good. The staff was kind and helpful. The outside seating was great.

Visited Aveiro today and randomly called in here-what a treat! Amazing breads and sweet pastries, great prices, and the friendliest hostess who really made us feel welcome. Thank you for letting me practice my Portuguese but also speaking perfect English with us. The whole experience was completely lovely.
Nice bakery. Bread is very good and they make wonderful cakes.
Great croissants, lots of different kinds of bread.
Amazing pastry and wonderful bread :)

I have received excellent service from this company, and I'm not just a one-off customer. I'm a disabled person and I go every month. I've bought more than five wheelchairs, scooters, and various other items. I understand that some people don't know how to shop, so I don't pay attention to negative comments. Many thanks to Rodrigo and Mrs. Madalena.

The address was a little tricky to find at first, as Google Maps directed us the wrong way, we eventually located it with the help of a nearby shop. Once found, access was easy with the self check-in and door code system.
Be prepared for a couple of flights of stairs, and a motion light would have been useful for our early departure. The communal areas were spotless, and the kitchen was exceptionally well equipped, even better than many Airbnbs I‚Äôve stayed in, with everything you‚Äôd need to prepare meals, including a coffee machine.
The bedroom was super clean, comfortable, and thoughtfully laid out. The en-suite bathroom could benefit from a towel rail for drying towels, but otherwise it was great.
The location was a pleasant surprise, the train station is just a three-minute walk away, and there‚Äôs also an underground passage that takes you straight to the bus terminal across the road. That was a big win for us, as one of our group had an early bus to catch (just note that the escalators aren‚Äôt running early in the morning).
Overall, a great stay, clean, convenient, and well set up for short visits.

Check in was scheduled to happen at 15h, got a call to ask if it was possible to check in later at 17h. I agreed and when I got there, the number was offline, the manager had to come greet us in (which was lucky since he was about to leave).

The walls are paper thin, the bathroom floor was flooded after every shower despite our best efforts and the closet nearly fell on me since it's not secure to the wall - as soon as I reached for the handle it started tipping over. A 2.5meter closet. Suffice to say we didn't really store our clothes during our already shortened stay.

Perhaps we got the worse room or got unlucky, but from my experience, it's unlikely for me to return here.

Note: We rented this with a 40% discount and we took the price into consideration when grading Aveiro White House.

Location: right next to the station, but a few minutes walk (15mins)  from the center and the tourist area.

Accomodations: we rented an apartment, it was nice and pretty clean, had everything we needed (basic things, no luxuries)

Surroundings: supermarket is a few minutes down the road, its small but it has most things. Pharmacy also down the road. Train station and bus stops right next door.

Service: Very helpful, we had an issue in the middle of the night and they answered roght away.
Clean, central and essential staff quite invisible. At 5 the go do you have to take the baggage before. Not a proper store service
Jus one bathroom for 5 rooms is not enough.
Paula Santos was great in helping us switch out cars when the original wasn't working right. Thank you very much in going the extra mile. Thank you Paula!

My partner rented a car from Avis for a few days. Booked it online in advance through Vamosencoche against a very affordable rate. Good and quick service at the desk (very near to the train station where we arrived) and a brand new car. Very recommendable. Must do: visit Costa Nova Beach and Aveiro Lagoon.
Scam, trying to get every cent out of you by changing contracts and fees around. Dont go there

Easy process, very friendly staff!
Car was new and clean
Friendly and helpful service.

Great place to rent a car. The two workers I met during my visit were both very helpful and explained everything very clearly. I recommend this place to anyone who is looking to rent a car for a good price with good customer service.
Good team, good customer service

place_name: Art drop luggage and other stuff
review_text: Had a great experience here overall, I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking to drop off their luggage for a short period of time. Fyi they do accept both cash and credit cards, and there is no need to book anything online in advance, super simple process.

place_name: Art drop luggage and other stuff
review_text: Excellent place to leave a luggage for a day! Thank you :)

place_name: Art drop luggage and other stuff
review_text: Great place to drop off your luggage! Very close to train station and reasonably priced.

place_name: Art drop luggage and other stuff
review_text: Always very kind and helpful.

place_name: Art drop luggage and other stuff
review_text: Perfect place to store your luggage when in Aveiro. Nice staff, nice original art for sale.
Perfect place to have a galao and a delicious pasta de nata while waiting for a train. Offers outside seating. This simple, authentic and cheap cafe is ideal to fill a gap in a travel schedule.
We bought these today, after eating half of it, we found out that it was full of mold... very disappointed
Excellent ovos moles and pastel de nata, the coffee is also very good and the lady behind the counter is very kind and helpful
Didn't receive my purchase.

absolutely out of touch service. outrageous prices. and worker Joao laughs at clients making fun saying they dont have money. there‚Äôs a reason i‚Äôm buying at your business and your working there. if i didn‚Äôt have money i would not pay 350‚Ç¨ to have a car for 3 days?????????  i would never buy here again or recommend to anyone. this worker should not be working in costumer service
We had a great customer service in the Aveiro Avis office!
Good all around. I liked the attention and service, and the car was excellent.
Nice place near the main station with delicious traditional Nata
Just had coffee and toast and it was so-so but what got to me was the guy who served me did not come off the phone the whole time I was there.
We were in Aweiro for three days. Every morning we went to this bakery for coffee and sandwiches/cake. They were very tasty and reasonably priced. Good communication in English.
Perfect service and great atmosphere. I highly recommend!

place_name: Monumento a Dr. Louren√ßo Sim√µes Peixinho
review_text: This monument honors Dr. Louren√ßo Sim√µes Peixinho, a visionary leader who played a key role in the modernization of Aveiro. It was erected in 1952 by the city at the starting point of the central avenue that now bears his name. Dr. Peixinho served as the president of the Aveiro Municipal Council (a role equivalent to today‚Äôs mayor) from 1918 to 1942. During his 24-year tenure, he spearheaded major urban development projects, including the creation of the main avenue, public parks, and hospitals‚Äîlaying the foundation for the city‚Äôs transformation in the 20th century.

Outstanding stay at Tricana de Aveiro! Perfect accommodation in Aveiro.

We had a truly lovely stay at one of the best places to stay in Aveiro for comfort, cleanliness, and location. The check-in was smooth and easy, and the owners are extremely friendly, professional, and welcoming, making us feel at home immediately.

The room was beautiful, spacious, and spotlessly clean, with a pleasant view and a calm atmosphere perfect for relaxing. Everything was well-maintained and thoughtfully prepared, which really enhanced our overall experience.

If you‚Äôre looking for high-quality accommodation in Aveiro, a clean and cozy guesthouse near the city center, and excellent customer service, Tricana de Aveiro is an excellent choice. Highly recommended for couples and travelers who value comfort and hospitality. And we love their little bakery!

Didn‚Äôt use the hotel (sadly) but it was probably the best place we‚Äôve ever waited for a train! At the outside cafe tables you can gaze at the old station. Really outstanding pastries. I had a Torrada as well, and was very pleased I did! The cafe is signed up to the baggage storage scheme Bounce, meaning you can easily drop your bags in the cafe for a few euros for a few hours, then walk down into Aveiro. Excellent service too. Thank you!

I got a single room for a few days, and I adore it. It has a beautiful view, easy check-in, and is affordable. It sits right across from the train station, so it's easy to catch a train anywhere. The room is small but clean and fully equipped. The bakery on the ground floor is an added bonus. There is no elevator because well there are only 3 floors?
Amazing experience! Excellent location, super nice. Patricia was so helpful, very friendly and kind! The rooms were very nice and clean, the staff very nice too!

This is the perfect spot to wait for the train: next door in a beautiful building with a view to the stunning old station, with great coffee and cakes, eg. excellent ovos moles(also to go), all at fair prices in a pleasant ambiance with in- and outdoor seating and great table service with an old time central cashier to pay afterwards.

Excellent experience. First time using Bounce - so a bit of learning took place. Of note: 1) many of these, I think, are other businesses which are contracted (or contract) to hold your luggage in a secure locked location. I was looking for a ‚ÄòBounce‚Äô storefront. The location was a cafe and it was absolutely clearly marked, but I was new so it took me few extra minutes to figure it out.

But, like I said. It was an excellent experience. Go ahead and reserve online ahead of time, or you will be standing at the place doing the reservation. All online. Pick your drop off and pick up times. Get the code. Show the code. Drop your bags.

This is the best option for storing your luggage in Aveiro because there is no luggage storage at the train station. It‚Äôs a little hard to find if you don‚Äôt realize it‚Äôs inside a caf√© across the street from the station. Once you find it, you pay and they store your bags in a little room in back of the caf√© so that you can visit the town without luggage. We stored at about 10am and picked up at 3pm. Everything costs Euros-
Great service across the road from the station. The lady was very helpful.
Close to the station, extremely kind and helpfull host. I reccomend the location not Just for the luggage storage but also for coffee and pastries
Easy, convenient and safe. I felt really comfortable leaving my luggage there while I enjoyed Aveiro.

Arrived @12.15, crowded, manage to get a table, notice that all are local peoples, just 2 of us is tourist, no English menu, bases on photo on goggle map to order a soup, pork chop with rice, fish and house wine. Delicious and tasty üëçall are local food, and just cost euro 20.00 !!! The staff is friendly and helpful to assist us to order food, fantastic üòç must try.
Simple, tasty food. Affordable prices. Local atmosphere. Nice personnel.

Good traditional Portuguese food. The place was extremely full by 12.15 on a Wednesday lunchtime. The owner didn't speak English, but was welcoming and helpful. He soon set a table for us. We love places like this: nothing fancy, just good honest stuff. The portions were large, the wine was included and the price was more than fair.

Nothing fancy, but they serve the local food prepared with heart. I enjoyed..
However, not a place for vegetarians or vegans.
Very cosy family restaurant. Service is very good. A good selection of affordable set lunch available there

The guesthouse is perfectly located if you arrive by train. Only 100 yards from the station. I didn't notice any intrusive noise from the railway. You can check-in in the cafe which is part of the same building. The guy I spoke to speaks a bit of English as well. The rooms have aircon and tv including cartoon channels if you have children.  I had a room with a balcony. It was very clean on my arrival. Only criticism so far is the room needs a couple of chairs so you could sit outside on the balcony. The cafe downstairs sells a good selection of the usual pastries etc. 2 more nights here but so far so good üëç
The room is not big but the bed is comfortable and easy to check-in! Everything is good! Nothing to complain!

Bit of a mixed experience. The lady who checked us in was very nice and responsive. The room, however, did not get actual daylight and is in the hallway. This also means people pass by in the night, causing plenty of sound and light. Do not recommend if you're a light sleeper. Still, pretty nice place and well located.

Very nice place of accommodation, located right next to Aveiro's central train station and main bus terminal. If you plan to stay in Aveiro for a few days, I would recommend booking a few nights at this relaxing place with a very friendly owner who also owns a caf√© next to the guesthouse. The rooms are nice, the shared kitchen offers all necessary equipments for cooking and the shared bathroom is satisfactory too.
Bad staff & very dirty
Really nice, clean and comfortable place . Good price-quality. Super nice and warm staff! Definetely would go back!
Inexpensive rooms. Right next to the train station. 10-15 minute walk from downtown. Nice staff.
You get what you pay for. Could be cleaner. Went on a busy day, hot water was an issue.
Very nice place with an wonderful price
Absolutely brilliant place to stay. Very affordable.
Near the center, easy access.
Top ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞
The first apartment they gave us was very small and dark. They didn't move us to a larger, more welcoming apartment.

An excellent pasteleria that also offers daily lunch specials. The prices are very reasonable and the portions are generous. The mole eggs are also very good. The service is friendly and welcoming. Located right next to the train station, it's well worth the detour from the historic center and its tourist traps.

We stayed in the apartments of the same name next door and took the opportunity to have a snack there. The pastel de nata (cream pastries) were delicious, there are Aveiro magnets to take home as a souvenir, and they also sell little boxes of ovos moles (a typical dessert from the area). Highly recommended, and the waitress was very attentive.
Can't find a store. Has it closed?
Old-fashioned
Top
Kind and patient hosts. Fries are excellent. Hot dogs ‚Äúsemplice‚Äù come with crunchy shoestring potatoes.  The pork tart was also good - like a pot pie.  Good for a summer lunch.
Delicious cakes and coffee from a very friendly staff.

Extremely disappointing experience

The property advertises on Booking.com that a baby cot is available for the selected room. However, upon arrival there was no baby cot, and in any case, it would not have fit in the room as it was far too small.

Additionally, there were no bed sheets provided. When we asked the owner, we were told: ‚ÄúThis is not a hotel, but there is a blanket available‚Äù ‚Äî a blanket that had clearly been used by many others before. The level of hygiene was completely unacceptable, and this was never disclosed when making the reservation.

Another major issue was the excessive noise. It felt as though we were staying in a nightclub, with constant disturbance from both other guests inside the apartment and from a bar or club located directly below.

When we contacted the owner to explain that this was not at all what had been advertised and that we wished to cancel, we were told: ‚ÄúSorry, you are already checked in, so we cannot do anything.‚Äù The service was not only unhelpful but also delivered in an arrogant manner.

We have already raised this matter with Booking.com and will also make it known to other platforms.

Overall, the stay was not even worth ‚Ç¨10. Even a hostel would have been a far better option.

Absolutely terrible!!!

They advertise on booking.com that they have a crib available for the selected room.
Once on-site, there's no crib available, and it doesn't fit in the room anyway; it's far too small.

They don't have any sheets to cover you up. After asking the owner, they say, "Yes, this isn't a hotel, but there is a blanket available (which has probably already been used by 100 others). Hygiene is lacking. This isn't mentioned when booking either.

Finally, it feels like being in a nightclub. There's a terrible amount of noise, both from the other people in the apartment and from some kind of nightclub/bar below.

I contacted the owner and told them this is absolutely not what they advertise and that we want to cancel. They said, "Sorry, we've already checked you in and can't do anything more for you."
The service is shockingly poor, and they're arrogant.

We've already contacted booking.com and will inform other providers.

All in all, it's not even worth 10 euros; even a hostel is 10x better.

Excellent location
Spartan and comfortable room
The living room is very useful for a beer and a read.

The rooster alarm clock that crows early in the morning is a nice touch!! üòÇüòÇüêì
Wonderful dresses. Everything is perfect.
I need to repair my necklace and have to recommend. The lady was truly nice, able to speak in English and a reparation took 3 days for 5‚Ç¨. Truly have to recommend, truly good job! Thanks :)
Very kind and welcoming, and great food!
Nice coffee with butter croissant. Friendly staff.
Love this Brazilian place
The owner is very friendly and takes great care of his guests' comfort. The breakfast is great and the rooms are very comfortable.

place_name: Loja do Bangladesh Halal Shop Aveiro
review_text: Good Service  and good shope

A truly traditional Portuguese kitchen ‚Äî it feels like being a welcomed guest visiting a local family. The dishes are inexpensive and served quickly. There‚Äôs no printed menu, so I had to ask about the options, but the main dish costs around ‚Ç¨7 and the soup about ‚Ç¨2, with the option to order a half portion. The owners don‚Äôt speak English, but they were very kind and patient. The setting is very simple, which I wouldn‚Äôt normally appreciate, but the family running the place was so sweet and welcoming that it made the whole visit much more enjoyable. The food was hearty and filling, though it might not be ideal for those who aren‚Äôt fans of traditional Portuguese cuisine. The only downside was that the salad came already season with vinegar.
From a tourist's perspective: local restaurant with very little English. Tjey have daily meals priced at 6 Euros and reasonably priced drinks. Clean environment friendly service and tasty food.
Great little local restaurant. Very reasonable prices. Had homemade soup. Then main dish local meat stew & and chicken chips, ‚Ç¨6 soup ‚Ç¨1.50.
Everything was delicious. The cod was delicious and fresh, and the strawberry mousse was amazing. Very friendly staff and a great price.

place_name: Doutor Carlos Almeida & Castro Lda - Ortopedia
review_text: Kind and professional. I've had two orthopedic visits and I've been satisfied. He speaks a little English.

Doctor was nice, but the physical therapy department is a total disaster. Therapists are often absent so you never know who you are going to get. The auxiliar staff ignores you even though they are looking at you trying to express your pain and discomfort. Receptionists spend half the time talking to themselves about their private life even though there is people in front of them waiting to be helped. When you give them some feedback, they say ‚Äúthat‚Äôs all we can do‚Äù
Patients are left alone many times.
Good professionals but the admission system is a mess. A simple process analysis could improve radically the bottleneck

I am travelling from Canada and had a medical issue to be dealt with. I had extremely professional, friendly and expert professionals looking after me. Their care was efficient and they kept me informed of the care plan. The nurse and physician worked very closely together and made all attempts to understand my very minimal Portuguese. I worked in health care in Canada and have never been as impressed as I was here at CMM in Aveiro. Thank you.

This place sucks.
Long wait, discourteous reception staff, particularly booth 1.
Then they tried to charge me twice the price agreed for my test, supposedly one for each leg. I refused, they verified and finally told me it had been a mistake.
Top
The shop is super cute, and the staf is nice and open to help! :)

This place had a very cool vibe. I enjoyed looking through the racks, but unfortunately it was mostly brands you can find at the mall, nothing spectacular if you're looking for designer items or one of a kind items. I did happen to find a missoni shirt for 5‚Ç¨ And they had a cool Max Mara linen blazer, that I left it was a little dated. If I had enough room in my suitcase, I probably would've got that too.

Quite a good offer, a few gems always available if you have the patience to search. Bought a few items here, everything top notch. Then it's not a scam like Humana, it actually helps worthy causes and fights the good fight. Can only recommend these chaps.

100% recommendable! Found some really beautiful clothes there and the owners are very lovely. When I showed them a stain on one piece (which I wasn't sure of if it would come off with washing) they reduced the price of it. Support a good cause and check this store out! :)
I went to this pharmacy for some injections. The service was very good; Mrs. Diva performed my injections. She was kind and professional. Thank you for everything! I recommend this pharmacy.

The best Korean barbecue in Portugal. The service is truly outstanding, the best I‚Äôve ever had at any Han Table. Clarisse and Martin were wonderful, incredibly quick, and genuinely attentive. I became a fan after visiting the Han Table locations in Porto and Lisbon, and I‚Äôm so happy they‚Äôve opened one in Aveiro. It already feels like my favorite place to eat.

If you want incredible barbecue, amazing staff, and pork beef delicious enough to haunt your dreams come here. I already came twice in the same week and bring all my friends.
The meat was very delicious, the vibe was great and our waiter Zenny was super nice and helpful. Will come again ü§©
Finally in Aveiro, amazing service and waitresses. Fantastic food and cocktails.

It was delicious, especially the Australian Wagyu beef and Korean soju. The owner told us many interesting stories and enthusiastically guided us on how to prepare the food. It was very fun and inexpensive!
Great food. Service is good but the waiters do not speak portuguese.

place_name: Germano de Sousa - Posto GS - Aveiro - Av. Dr. Louren√ßo Peixinho
review_text: Excellent service. The lady's attention was brilliant. Professional, pleasant, and friendly. The location was perfect, and the prices were the best on the market.

Unbeatable cheap prices for really good pizzas and burgers.
The other dishes we didn't try jet, but sure they are great as well.
They also serve wine for 50 cents.
The staff is very attentive.
Never went out hungry, so we go nearly everyday now.
Delicious and simple Portuguese food, little bar/restaurant, perfect if you want to feel Portuguese vibe
Its very good place i like IT
I went with my husband and I loved the food and the attention. We ordered pizza house. The attention was incredible. We hope to return

I was there with my friends and all of us had stomach issues after eating the "burger". We couldn't name it a real burger. It was not good and the fries were bad too. Only good thing was the staff, the lady behind the counter was very nice.
Friendly, many products MADE in Portugal, well done, great quality for these Portuguese products.
Used the Bounce Luggage service at this minimarket. The owner was very nice and helpful. Definitely recommended!

-one star because for each visit I get new different person.
-the plastic bag with glasses , razor and gel that I had to buy plus to the service I don‚Äôt like that idea neither
Place clean and the staff very helpful and nice
Very useful advice and great attention :)

Amazing store
With the best prices and quality service

Super friendly owner/operator in Derik.  He obviously cares deeply about his customers (treated more like friends and family).  The burgers are outstanding!  Seriously could not love them any more.  Homemade garlic mayo for the perfectly cooked shoestring fries is out of this world!  Overall an easy 5-star recommendation.

Amazing burger restaurant!
Perfect service and gentleman owner!
Big and delicious burgers there!
I highly recommand this place, thank you for the great experience for our first time in Aveiro (French tourists)

We had a great experience dining here. Our burgers were made just right. I loved the condiments which added layers to the taste. It was a bit quiet when we were there so we got to chat a bit with the owner who was very friendly and passionate about his handcrafted burgers.

We were visiting Aveiro just for a day and really craved a burger. I had a homemade veggie burger and my husband had a hamburger along with fries. They were amazing! We had a great chat with the owner and overall it was a great experience! Highly recommend for a fresh delicious burger!

We had an amazing experience here! First of all, the service was absolutely outstanding ‚Äì the person who welcomed us was so kind, explained everything perfectly and really made us feel at home. Honestly, it was incredible service. On top of that, the food was delicious ‚Äì the burgers were super tasty, fresh, and full of flavor. And the best part? The price was really affordable for the quality we got. Definitely a place I‚Äôd recommend 100%!
Spacious, very clean and organized....accessible prices....
Great service.
Excellent store for buying household items. Good price and quality. Excellent service.

I don't normally leave grumpy reviews but I really wish I'd not bothered staying here - anyone reading who thinks the decor looks charming and good location should be warned. The room I booked shared big, leaky doors with another room so we could hear absolutely everything and I'm sure they could hear us. Request to be moved was met with disinterest. The toilet was right opposite the bed, with a pane of glass between it. Extremely loud main road beneath window. Check in was late and confusing. Room stank of smoke from wildfires (curtains especially) which is not their fault but they could have tried to air it out,. Thanks only to the friendly warm housekeeper lady in the cafe below who was the only person who made us feel even slightly welcome.

The Bohemian Place is a below average guest house. The facilities haver a check-in machine which means that during your stay you never actually talk to anyone welcoming you to the place.
The room was rather small, nothing like the pictures, the bathroom was weird looking, the bedroom lacked a proper cleaning (clearly the cleaning staff is overwhelmed with all the rooms), there was no proper water pressure in the shower, the soap and the shampoo that they say they supplied was crearly not enought for our stay and it was not replenished.
The saving grace was the person at the breakfast (which by the way, you have to exit the building to access it), once again she was underwhelmed dealing with the breakfast all by herself, restocking the food trays and so on. The food was good.

I will clearly not stay here again, as long as I remember.

Small, cozy, and clean room. The bed was comfortable. The water in the shower is unpredictable but usually very hot although lacking pressure.

Close to the core of the city and its canal system.

Free parking a short 2 minutes walk.

#ZERO STARS# Stay away!!! This is classic tourist trap. More like a mid renovation hostel than a hotel. The bathrooms have no doors. Water in the shower is intermittently boiling/cold. You'll want to skip breakfast. Worst touristic accomodation experience I've ever had. (You can see in the photos there is no door to the bathroom).
Just amazing! For an "out of routine" weekend it's perfect! Went here one time but definitely coming back!
I got a great haircut and I have learned very little Portuguese
Luisa was flexible and would accommodate me on short notice; the cut was impeccable and I appreciate the attention to detail. Thanks!
So nice service. I got very beautiful color nails from here. Happy with Luisa‚ù§Ô∏è
Very good place and groceries and mini Mercado halal food provided and meat chicken beef and simply too good
They have good quality clothes. I was expecting cheaper prices because I am used to another kind of second hand shop. But if you are looking for good quality and new clothes maybe it's your place.
I love this shop! Every time we go there, we find great clothes. Great selection of basics and special pieces second hand and outlet. My favorite second hand shop!

Beautiful thrift shop! Very nice owner :-) Some articles are more expansive than others but if you look well you can find authentic stuffs for a low price! For example, I found a handbag puma orignal for 12 ‚Ç¨
Great Service
Excellent service for repairing your gadgets! Responsible staff, I recommend.
Really talented osteopath & healer. One of the most beautiful, clean, & professional spaces I‚Äôve been to in Aveiro. I highly recommend Carla!

A kind, professional, and knowledgeable person. Her holistic approach will give you a broader view of the problem you need to solve. I had two sessions, I was satisfied, and I would have continued if I hadn't been forced to return to Italy. The doctor also speaks English! Thank you!

Thank you both so much for advising me on the repair of my glasses. I really appreciate both the advice and care that you both gave me. Definitely an optician that you can trust!
Yvonne

Priscila is welcoming and knowledgeable and captures all of our ideas into a beautiful and genuine project. Her knowledge of architecture and interior design is exceptional. Priscila is very familiar with the Nordic and minimalist style ‚Äì we felt her guidance was invaluable in designing our space. Her focus on detail and on the client is remarkable and it was an immense joy to work with her ‚Äì both in person and in virtual sessions, it was very easy to communicate as she is extremely organised with the project and decor lists. I am grateful to have learned so much from her. I highly recommend Priscila!
Top!
Top
Excellent employees... Good service, fast, they solve your problems... Good prices.
We had an electrical issue with our car. This company took a couple of days to get to it, but when they did the problem was solved and at minimal expense. Very happy with the outcome
Super helpful
Poor service, they keep you waiting overnight with no results or answers regarding an engine head. It's been over three weeks now without a response.

Extreme bad experience Movyng car rental Aveiro. I paid, deposit went to the middle of nowhere to pick up a car, and there was nobody, although Discovery told me, that there would be people waiting. Than i had to col to Lisbon Headquaters then they found the lady. She told wanted me to send the voucher and I did. It took an hour and half to get the answer to cancel the reservation, because they were closed at the moment of reservation. Very bad anti-proactive approach, strongly not reccomend
Great price and I was very well attended to by Sandra.

Had a great experience with Moving car rental they went above with courtesy and professionalism and were very flexible in changing our vehicle to something..cooler..in thier lot ...would use them again

place_name: Casa das Baterias - Jo√£o Pires Fernandes
review_text: Very professional and to the point. Polite and sympathetic staff. Recommended

place_name: Casa das Baterias - Jo√£o Pires Fernandes
review_text: Today experience with friends‚Ä¶.

place_name: Casa das Baterias - Jo√£o Pires Fernandes
review_text: Today we ran out of battery on vacation. We saw the good reviews and took the car to them. They fixed the problem in 15 minutes, gave us a new battery, and provided impeccable service. I recommend them. Thanks!

The service was friendly, but since they don't speak English, there was some confusion about my order‚Äînothing serious. The food was good. I liked the ham and sausages for an appetizer, and many people came to take away their orders. The grilled pork was good, but flavor was quite simple however.

Was staying locally for the weekend in Aveiro and looking for a place to eat . This restaurant was one of the hotel's recommendations.

Declined the starter meats and bread which is offered to diners and went straight for the main course from the wide ranging choice of meals in the menu - half a grilled chicken served with boiled rice and chips and a green salad (had to check whether it was served with any side dishes because the menu wasn't clear).  The half chicken arrived in 3-4 pieces from memory, and it was cooked well.  For those who like wine with their meal, the restaurant carries a varied selection of wines with quite a few visible on display.

Overall, the meal was filling and reasonably priced.  There were a wide range of diners of all ages - couples and families. Service was friendly with a good vibe and the restaurant was well staffed.  They were accomodating with me not being able to speak Portugese and understood my English so fair play to them - obrigado!

My recent birthday celebration at Churrasqueira Sal na Brasa was an absolute success, largely thanks to their excellent service and delicious food. I booked in advance for a large group, and upon arrival, our table was perfectly prepared, and the staff even offered to store our birthday cake until later ‚Äì a thoughtful touch that set a positive tone for the evening.
We started with some appetizers before diving into the main courses. My girlfriend and I shared two dishes: the Picanha (top sirloin cap) and Bifes de Peru (turkey steaks). The meat was exceptional, especially the Picanha, which was cooked to perfection and incredibly flavorful. The entire table was impressed with their meals, and everyone had more than enough side dishes to feel completely satisfied.
While we brought our own birthday cake, the staff was still incredibly accommodating, providing everything we needed to enjoy it comfortably. The service throughout the evening was consistently friendly and attentive, making us feel well-cared for.
The restaurant itself had warm lighting and a comfortable ambiance, contributing to a relaxed and enjoyable dining experience.
Churrasqueira Sal na Brasa delivered on all fronts for a memorable birthday dinner.

Excellent restaurant! The meat are grilled downright delicious and the wine is so exquisite. The place has a nice atmosphere, and the service was excellent. I like the calming music as well. The light, food, and catering are all five-star level. Picanha and red wine combo is recommended. Enjoy your time here

Loved this! If you're in Aveiro! Take a walk and go have a meal here! The meat offering is great, and the owners are so warm and hospitable... The Sangria was so yummy üòãüòãüòã and the prices are not bad at all... If it is available, try the coconut cake, it's amazing!

Bedbugs and lying crooks summarizes my and my girlfriends very brief stay att Urban suites in Aveiro. We arrived around 11 in the evening. After getting ready for bed we noticed a bug on the wall behind the bed (see photo). No question, it was a bedbug. We also saw numerous black dots on the bed linen (indicating bedbug feces). Sadly, we had not been reading the Google reviews beforehand, as we now see that several others has had similar experiences. We tried to call the two telephone numbers provided by Urban suites, but no answer. Refusing to sleep in the room, we went out and checked in at another hotel in the middle of the night (Hotel Aveiro center‚ù§). When we texted Urban suites in the morning and they actually answered us, they started denying any bedbugs (saying they checked the room and didn't see any bugs), they denied that we had called (although we obviously have proof of that). We asked for a refund, but of course they rejected us and implied that we were making everything up and lying. So in short, nasty rooms and unpleasant staff. The location is acceptable I guess. Would not recommend.

We stayed here for a romantic escape in Aveiro.
What a lovely surprise, the location is perfect for a walk into the city, lots of shops and attractions near.
The room was very clean and nicely decorated. The staff when around was always friend and we had a lovely breakfast too.
There is a lovely terrace were you can enjoy the sun and hopefully we can go back for the sunset parties in future.
We will definitely go back.

Close to the city centre, good price-quality ratio! It was good enough for the price to just sleep over the nights. Clean, kitchen with toaster and microwave and outside terrace to enjoy evening drinks or morning breakfast.

I love this place it not far from center walk to the center around 8 mins it is in the good area, if you come with the car behind the building have the big parking free .. the room size it not really big but for me it good enough to stay 3 people the checkin can do with machine (it really nice)

Only couple thing that i not gave 5 stars  it is the noise from the road from the room that we stayed and the toilet have some smell from the tube pipe but the less it is ok clean enough,  comfortable,  has nice terrace not far from center , fair price.

Pros: Great location and self check-in.

Cons: Overpriced rooms, look better in the pictures than what it actually is and it‚Äôs staff doesn‚Äôt speak English nor Spanish.
Bom proficional
Very good food. Not very expensive.
Excellent service by the gentleman. He helped me get international post card stamps and we purchased a postal book of Fatima.
I wanted to send important documents abroad,Staff was amazingly friendly and gave best services in my language(English),big thanks to (Cristina staff member)

Hello. First time when I have problems with CTT. They put a wrong sticker to wrong package(it been made on purpose or by mistake). And I got a package for other person. Tried to solve this issue in office but they told me to go away. Terrible experience

Disappointing Experience at Domino's Pizza in Aveiro

I recently visited Domino's Pizza in Aveiro with a group of friends, excited to try the "all you can eat" menu that included unlimited drinks. Unfortunately, the experience fell short of our expectations, and I would like to share my negative review with you.

Upon arrival, we were informed that the "all you can eat" menu did not include unlimited drinks as we had anticipated. Instead, we were offered a menu without any drinks included, but at the same price. This discrepancy from the advertised offer left us disappointed, as we had specifically chosen the restaurant for the option of unlimited drinks.

Furthermore, we expressed our dissatisfaction to the staff and the misunderstanding that had occurred. We were disappointed that no discount or remedy was offered for the inconvenience. It would have been appreciated if a gesture of goodwill had been made to compensate for the discomfort caused.

Regarding the food, we were let down by the quality that didn't resemble a real pizza in the slightest. The pizzas lacked flavor, the texture of the crust was not authentic, and it seemed that the ingredients used were of low quality. We didn't expect to have an artisanal pizza, but the difference was so noticeable that it was difficult to truly enjoy the food.

In conclusion, my experience at Domino's Pizza in Aveiro was disappointing due to the lack of unlimited drinks as promised in the "all you can eat" menu, the absence of any remedy or discount offered for the inconvenience, and the quality of the food that bore no resemblance to a real pizza. I cannot fully recommend this restaurant to those seeking a satisfying pizza experience.

I hope that my review can be helpful to those looking for alternatives for a pizza evening in Aveiro.

Don't order their pizza on glovo, they have the worst delivery service and spoiler alert: your pizza will never arrive. When you try to call them to ask where your pizza is, they just hang up the call because they do not speak english apparently.
Make sure to get a table outside if you‚Äôre getting the  ‚ÄúCome e Bebe‚Äù Menu, otherwise if you step a toe nail out of the door while eating inside, the manager will stop getting you food.
Horrible delivery service. Guys just come at whatever time they please, then leave with the pizza. So you must walk for it to the shop like you didnt order delivery.
The employees are all very nice and helpful.

We found this bistro by chance thanks to an ad for the EURO 2024 menu. So far we have only tasted the warm menu take-away and we really liked it. The food was ready on time and the staff was very pleasant and attentive! Thank you, we will definitely order again! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Staff was very friendly and the food was served quickly
The service was in the schedule, the food was good and the gyosa were great. Above all, they were super generous with all the sauces. The space atmosphere could be improved, though

The staff here is definitely very dedicated and professional. Great service. Great prize.
The best

I booked by phone on the day of the booking and were warmly welcomed upon arrival by the friendly lady at the entrance. The decoration is simple and modern, creating a pleasant atmosphere, but the real star here is the food. Every dish was outstanding: extremely tasteful, beautifully presented, and with generous portions. We chose the CARPACCIO DI MANZO RAFFAELLO as a starter and had for main; LINGUINE AL PESTO CON STRACCIATELLA and TORTELLONI DI PERA E GORGONZOLA. We finished with CHEESECAKE AL PISTACCHIO.
Il Libertino is located slightly outside the city center of Aveiro, but it‚Äôs absolutely worth the short trip if you appreciate authentic and beautifully crafted Italian cuisine. A true gem, definitely to be repeated!

I really wanted to like this place, it‚Äôs so pretty but although it has good flavor the pasta was overcooked . The gnocchi literally melted in your mouth and turned to mush. My tuna was cooked to within an inch of its life, super dry and chewy. Disappointed and high prices.

Unfortunately, after our visit to the restaurant, we both ended up with stomach upset. Mine was quite severe and ended with vomiting. Either the tortellini or the cheesecake was not fresh. The place itself is charming, and the dishes were tasty, but the suffering afterwards ruined the overall experience.

The food was good, but not worth waiting ao long - we waited almost 1 hour for it. also, they said we couldn‚Äôt get entrees before the main dish. It makes you wonder what‚Äôs the point of offering entrees. I don‚Äôt quite recommend

Il Libertino in Aveiro is a charming Italian restaurant that offers a delightful dining experience. The cozy atmosphere, with its low lighting and tasteful decor, creates a romantic and intimate setting.

The service was impeccable. Our server was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. They were always on hand to ensure that our needs were met throughout the evening.

The food was truly exceptional. We started with a delicious plate of bruschetta, followed by a creamy risotto di zucca and a classic spaghetti alla carbonara. Both dishes were cooked to perfection, with the flavors blending harmoniously. To finish, we indulged in a decadent profiterole, which was the perfect sweet ending to our meal.

While there was a minor oversight with our dessert order, the staff quickly rectified the situation with apologies, demonstrating their commitment to customer satisfaction.

Overall, Il Libertino is a fantastic choice for a romantic dinner or a night out with friends. The combination of delicious food, attentive service, and a cozy atmosphere makes it a memorable experience.
Very good coffee and service.

Is a good stop to eat something. Our Tuna no prato was good enough with the salad. I tried the Frize Limao and I liked it. Ypu have the park to visit just in front of you. The only tricky point is parking. All the city was crowded...

The appointment went smoothly, she is gentle and has attention to detail. I love my tattoos, they‚Äôre beautiful and perfectly executed, thanks so much Luiza !

If you're looking for fine line, Samuca is your guy. If you're looking for something AMAZING, Samuca is your guy!

I was in Aveiro for a few weeks holiday and was researching tattoo parlours, this one really stuck out to me and I got in touch with the team, all easy and seamless and on the day I met Ana-Luisa who talked through the whole process with me, she was kind and patient and ultimately I was super happy with the result of my fine line tattoo, I can not recommend them enough and will 100% be back when I visit again!
The artists are so kind! They want you to love your tattoo. Best spot in Portugal! Come for fine lines 10/10!!

More would have just made the choice more agonising. Food was plentiful and delicious. Service was homely and friendly and the atmosphere was cosy.

You‚Äôd be missing out if you came to Aveiro and didn‚Äôt eat at this AMAZING restaurant.üòç

What an amazing restaurant! Yesterday I had their salad and quiche and I returned today for more. The owners are lovely and speak great English and put a lot of attention in their work.

This is a place I will frequent a lot.

Just a short walk from the touristic centre of Aveiro, this restaurant offers a wide selection of beautiful salads and quiches. Fantastic food, probably the best we had in 3 weeks in Portugal. Huge portions, so order with that in mind. We ordered from the daily specials, goat and cod dishes and both were totally delicious, very home made and authentic. The dessert was excellent too, natas do ceu. Lovely place and even more lovely hosts, the food is absolutely amazing. The wine and dessert from the House will make your paladar go crazy! The prices are astonishingly good for the quality, definitely a must go when in Aveiro. A family business working at its best.

place_name: Un Poco Loco | Restaurante Mexicano em Aveiro
review_text:
Nice Mexican interior, many different decorations including a piranha aquarium. Very friendly staff, no problem to enter with small dog (pet friendly).
All dishes were served quickly. For me the most tasty was Enchiladas. Tacos was good, but expected more interesting sauce and spices. Unfortunately no burritos in the menu.

place_name: Un Poco Loco | Restaurante Mexicano em Aveiro
review_text:
For a fresh seafood lunch, I decided to try a Mexican restaurant that offered this option. The place is very well-maintained, with a great themed atmosphere.

The staff was incredibly quick, friendly, and smiling‚Äîthey were all excellent. If I lived in Aveiro, I would definitely return.

In addition to Mexican cuisine, they also make cocktails, and mine was truly excellent. I would return just to have it again. The bartender was really gifted.

My octopus tacos were certainly fresh and everything was good. There was just one downside, which is why I wouldn't order this taco again next time‚Äîthe octopus was overly masked by the other ingredients. However, this doesn't change my overall assessment of the place, which I think is excellent. I would probably really enjoy the original tacos.

place_name: Un Poco Loco | Restaurante Mexicano em Aveiro
review_text: This was one of the best Mexican meals we have ever had! Miguel took incredible care of us. The margaritas were outstanding and they were very knowledgeable about gluten free foods. Meeting up by chance with friends from home was an added bonus. I cannot recommend Un Poco Loco highly enough.

place_name: Un Poco Loco | Restaurante Mexicano em Aveiro
review_text:
I'm from Texas & I love tacos. I could eat tacos everyday. And these tacos definitely hit the spot! My favorite are the lubina (robalo [fish] tacos)!!! But it only comes with 2. However, a filet grilled comes on top and I think they are the best fish tacos ever!

The shrimp tacos were amazing! Big prawns that were battered. The chicken tacos were a bit salty but still good! The guac was heavy on the avocado ü•ë & a bit bland but I prefer bland to salty! Definitely will be back! I felt like the food was more like tex-mex than authentic Mexican. But what do I know? I'm from Texas üòÇ 3 tacos per order (we ordered 2 sets + guac + chips = 22‚Ç¨) The packaging and logo are SO cute! The strawberry üçì margarita is the BOMB. With cups lined with salt & paprika! Just the right kick. My favorite margarita place in aveiro now!

place_name: Un Poco Loco | Restaurante Mexicano em Aveiro
review_text:
Some of the best tacos we‚Äôve had!

Also have gluten free options and also they have a piranha ü¶∑ü¶∑ü¶∑

However everything else was perfect, chips with mayonaise were fresh and crisp, portion was big and affordable. Definitely a recommendation and I would gladly come back!
