For a lowbudget hostel this one is very good and I would definitely recommend! You can‚Äôt really expect more than that for this price. It may could be a bit more clean and the shower could be covered so that the water does not spread all over the bathroom
I had a flat tire on my stroller, and Mr. Jorge was very kind. He fixed the tire and saved our trip to Aveiro. Thanks, Jorge!!!

A hidden place next to train station where you can have a good food with a very nice price.
Super traditional place, with the daily options per 8 euros (Including bread, wine, coffee and dessert).
Keep in mind they don't accept card.
This place is legit. Serves a wonderful Leit√£o. I ordered a glass of wine and she puts a bottle on the table, respect.
It is a local restaurant near the train station. I had pumpkin soup, and it was delicious!
If you are looking for real Portuguese experience ‚Äî that's a place to go. Be ready to step out of your comfort zone ‚Äî no English here, authentic vibe that might be unusual, and simple dishes
Had a lovely meal of suckling pig, potato's and tomato salad. A real neighbourhood cafe off the main route. The lady cooks and serves the food. Very friendly and helpful. Would recommend.
Delighted with the welcome, comfort and cleanliness. I recommend.

Fast service
Very good egg mollusks
Top-notch, free parking nearby

Very knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive service to go along with an impressive collection of vintage watches. This is a hidden gem in Aveiro, if you love vintage timepieces then make sure to reach out to the shop owner to schedule a visit. They operate by appointment only but are well worth making time for, even if just to stop by for a quick chat.
Great buy and seller !
Really delicious cafe on Praia de Barra. Would recommend a tosta mista on a croissant ! The staff are patient and helpful :) This is my favourite cafe on the beach.
Nice staff, nice pastries.   Pizza is poor quality.  Pre-made base  and lots of  cheap cheese.

This was the worst service and food I‚Äôve experienced in a long time. We waited over an hour for our food, and after 30 minutes, we had to remind them to bring our drinks. When the food finally arrived, mine was dry and cold, while both of my friends received the wrong orders. One had to settle for the wrong order , a Francesinha that was shockingly bad, and the other had to wait an additional 10 minutes for the correct dish. To top it off, they had run out of fries.
Although they apologized and gave us a small discount by not charging for the drinks ‚Äî it was only a bottle of water and a small beer‚Äîhardly enough to make up for the terrible experience. Absolutely ridiculous.
The food is ok, but allowing people to smoke in a enclosed outside space is unnaceptable.

Very good bakery with friendly staff. Best bread rolls in Barra, great dish of the day offers with soup, drink and coffee included, delicious pastries and cakes. Affordable and of top quality. The staff is always helpful and the service is quick. You can dine-in or sit in a glass-house beer garden, you can also order for take-away, the food is packed nicely.
Great store and always with very nice clothes

This is THE surf shop in barra (I think it may be the first? Not sure). The owner & staff speak English. They always have pieces from the new seasons. We buy all our wetsuits, sandals, hats, surf screen and swim wear here. They have all the popular surf brands too. I always get my friends gifts from here as well. And they always have promotions going on!
Great shop, owner and staff super friendly. Awesome variety, prices are great. Really worth spending your time checking it out

A large selection of flip flops and great service from a young English-speaking saleswoman helped me to get exactly what I wanted. Note that despite the hours posted in Google they seem to be closed from 1-2:30 PM or so for lunch when I was there on a Saturday
The owner has a big heart, good prices and collections. Highly recommend to visit :)
Great place with cool people

Large selection of shoes for women, men, and children.
Unfortunately, the quality of the shoes is often not very good, but they are quite affordable. So, the price-performance ratio seems to be good.
If you're looking for shoes with a short lifespan and like to change your footwear often, you can shop here with confidence.
The shoes are very comfortable, but you have to be patient.

We had lunch there and the food was delicious!
We‚Äôve tried 3 types of risotto: with fish of the day, meat, mushrooms. All three were true gastronomical pleasure üòã
Deserts are amazing! Service is great. Definitely going to come again!

I had dinner in this restaurant 5 years ago. Until this day I remember what I had for the entree, main course and desert. I remember the taste of each. This is telling on how much I liked and was impressed with the food. Yesterday I went back to Aveiro just to repeat the experience, afraid that it might have changed. But it kept being the absolute best. I love it.

Their specialty is the Risotos (they have 5 currently). But even if you have something else, you can expect high level cuisine full of technique and inspiration.

But this time what impressed me the most was the desert. ‚ÄúYuzu Mochi‚Äù.

I had lunch at O Bairro restaurant in Aveiro and had a great experience. The service was friendly and attentive, and the food was flavorful and authentically Portuguese. The prices were reasonable, offering great value for the quality. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting to experience genuine Portuguese cuisine.

This is a five out of five-star restaurant. The dishes were simply amazing and deliciously prepared. The pork with truffle was well-balanced, tasty, and juicy. The fish of the day was perfectly cooked and bursting with fresh flavor. The dessert was perfect as well. Every bite reflected the chef‚Äôs attention to detail and passion for fine cuisine. Highly recommended!

Absolutely lovely restaurant in Aveiro.  Wonderful service.  That would be enough to recommend, but I must add that they have the very best risottos we have ever enjoyed.  They have at least 5 different risottos to match their varied dishes, and I suspect they are all just as delicious.  Frankly, their prices are too low for the quality of the restaurant overall.  You will need to make a reservation.  I was able to do this via Facebook, I think, with an email confirmation.  A don‚Äôt miss choice if visiting Aveiro.

We are super well.
This was on the list as an indication and I‚Äôm glad. The food was super nice and tasty. We had 1kg of fish and it had along the sides which can be adapted to your taste. Loved the service.

A Taste of Tradition: Generous Portions and Authentic Flavors in a Portuguese Setting

In my quest to explore the rich culinary traditions of Portugal, I found myself at this charming restaurant, where the essence of traditional Portuguese cuisine takes center stage. The experience was a testament to the country‚Äôs reputation for generous portions, bold flavors, and heartfelt hospitality.

My meal began with a classic Portuguese soup, a warm and comforting dish that exemplified simplicity done right. The ingredients were fresh, and the flavors were well-balanced, providing a perfect introduction to what lay ahead.

For the main course, I chose the grilled cod‚Äîa dish synonymous with Portuguese gastronomy. The portion was impressively generous, reflecting the restaurant's commitment to hospitality. The cod was expertly prepared, with a beautifully charred exterior that locked in its natural flavors while remaining moist and flaky inside. Paired with traditional accompaniments, this dish truly showcased the depth of Portugal‚Äôs culinary heritage.

The portions, as mentioned, were substantial, ensuring that no guest leaves unsatisfied. This, combined with the attention to flavor and preparation, elevates the restaurant to a must-visit status for those seeking an authentic Portuguese dining experience.

Beyond the food, the atmosphere of the restaurant deserves recognition. The rustic d√©cor and warm ambiance provide an inviting setting that enhances the meal, making it more than just a dining experience‚Äîit feels like a journey into Portugal‚Äôs cultural heart.

In summary, this restaurant delivers on all fronts: generous servings, expertly prepared dishes, and an ambiance that reflects the soul of Portugal. Whether you‚Äôre a local or a traveler, it‚Äôs a place that guarantees satisfaction and a genuine taste of tradition.

We took the bacalhau in the bread, and it was the only dish we ordered, so this may not be a full reflection of the restaurant. We thought the dish was a bit dry and lacked sauce. We also had trouble understanding the purpose of the thick bread surrounding the bacalhau as it didn't bring much to it in terms of flavors. However, the bacalhau in itself was very tasty, and the house wine was good!

This is a truly delicious local's spot Don't listen to the low reviews. They're not typical a travel-oriented spot where they try to lure you in to eat at their restaurant.  they're too busy serving customers!! They don't have time to hand hold and be overly friendly... We stood in line at the door. No one said anything to us at all, we waited patiently for 5 or 10 minutes till a table was available... They ushered us to a charming table and we were greeted by a most lovely Portuguese woman who didn't really speak English. She had an amazing smile and a warm heart and totally made you feel welcome. The food was absolutely amazing! The best we've had in Portugal yet and the staff was quite charming üôÇ they were all very gracious and nice. They just don't run to the door and greet you as you walk in. You have to be patient. It was so worth the meal. Truly amazing we had the pork and a delicious salad. Highly recommend this place

Not only were we amazed by the great selection of delicious dishes, but also by their great wine selection. We had a wonderful experience there and even got to taste some of the best Portuguese traditional dishes. The food was really scrumptious and the prices were very reasonable, making it an attractive option for anyone looking for amazing Portuguese cuisine. The friendly staff made us feel so welcomed that it felt like we were at home! All in all, it was a great experience and I would highly recommend this place to anyone who loves good food and great wine selection.

Great spot right in the center next to the Mercado do Peixe. We arrived at 8 p.m. and were lucky to get a table on the terrace before it filled up. The seafood cataplana was excellent, served with crispy fries, and the petiscos da casa were delicious. Local white and sparkling wines/espumoso recommended by the manager were perfect ‚Äî he‚Äôs very friendly and clearly passionate about wines. Highly recommended!

Without being overly hyperbolic this place had some of the best prawns I have ever eaten.
The clams were tasty but the sauce was a tiny bit thin. Still an amazing taste.
The secrets of pork were like the pork version of wagu beef. Greasy but in such an amazing way.

Been here twice and have had a lovely experience each time. Delicious food, especially the sea bass and the seafood rice. Our waiter, Paul, showed a lot of professionalism and charisma. Highly recommend and will come back next time we‚Äôre in Aveiro!!

Really good fish soup followed by an amazing grouper and prawns dish with rice and a very light cheese an lemon tart for desert.
I will no doubt visit again
Excellent choice for lunch. There were six of us, and the dishes were well-served, flavorful, and attentive. The prices and quality of service were excellent.

We had an amazing experience in this cosy restaurant nearby the canal! I wouldn‚Äôt miss it if I came to Aveiro!! Also my dietary requirement was taken so well into consideration and therefore the clams were absolutely perfect!

The staff or might be owner's daughter, seemed irritated when I asked for the price of the wine bottle. We've been scammed before, so we are very careful when asking for recommendations from restaurant staff. She mentioned that she doesn‚Äôt recommend tap water because of the salt content. She seemed to automatically expect us to agree to her wine recommendation and got irritated with our simple questions. She was less friendly compared to how she was initially before we asked.

When you travel often, you frequently encounter bad experiences, and I hope she understands that travelers like us learn to guard and protect ourselves from possible scams. There was nothing wrong with our questions for her to get upset. We didn't even take much time to ask about the price of the wine. Should we just believe her when she says it's cheap? I wasn't feeling well that day, and the ambience didn't feel good.

We ordered one soup, but two arrived, and of course, we were charged for two. The soup was mediocre; I think it was pumpkin soup. I've made better at home. They delivered food to our table with no explanation at all, and it took so long, with dishes arriving one by one. Are we supposed to eat just potatoes and salad? We had only two orders since we arrived 40 minutes ago, and we spent a total of 61 euros for lunch for two people.
It‚Äôs one of the best restaurants that ever tried. Best food in Portugal, feel free to order grilled fish and garlic shrimps.

A delightful hole-in-the-wall. We were not too hungry. Hence, only ordered soups accompanied by garlic bread and and an appetizer (small fried fish). But we were not frown upon. The fish soup was the best that we‚Äôve had in Aveiro, and perhaps in Portugal. The humble small fried fish was very fresh and umami, which I enjoyed very much with the white wine. Will definitely come back again to try their other dishes.
Incredible restaurant ! You will not be disappointed but rather surprised by the amazing experience you'll spend here. Just go and try by yourself the freshness of the dishes.

I had a lovely experience at Flower Garden in Aveiro. The food was delicious and thoughtfully prepared, with highlights like the cod risotto and red fruit dessert. The staff were welcoming and attentive, making the meal feel personal and relaxed. The setting is beautifully styled‚Äîlike a garden oasis right in the city‚Äîmaking it perfect for a calm, enjoyable lunch. Definitely worth a visit!

An excellent experience from start to finish! The staff was incredibly friendly and efficient, providing quick and attentive service. The food was amazing.

We were a group of four and ordered the meat board, pork belly, and sirloin with risotto. All dishes were perfectly cooked and beautifully presented. I must highlight that I asked for the sirloin to be well done, and it was cooked perfectly without being dry or rubbery - something rare to find in most restaurants.

For dessert, we chose the apple tart and the peanut cookie, both of which were equally delicious.

Definitely a place to revisit!

Good stuff. It‚Äôs a small chic hidden gem with flair. The chef knows how to create modern Portuguese and make it taste like something new and tasty. The ‚ÄúBarriga‚Äù was awesome! Crunchy on top, deliciously moist underneath with a creamy carrot sauce. The Arroz de Mar was delicious as well, with a well crafted mix of herbs. Also had the peanut butter bolacaha or ice cream sandwich with a hint of heat in the end and some good coffee. Overall a great experience.
Simply delicious!!! The food was amazing and the presentation was gorgeous. Recommend!!!
Beautiful atmosphere and superb flavors. Truly a memorable meal!
We had super tasty food here. We had the ‚Äúfestival of fish ‚Äú dish to share as well as a soup for starter. The staff were very nice and welcoming. they have indoors and outdoor seating.
really nice restaurant, lovely staff, great food especially the seafood. whilst on holiday i came to eat dinner here 4 times that‚Äôs how much i enjoyed it. highly recommend it.

The food was very delicious. The staff and service were amazing, they really try and go above and beyond. The table decoration was also really nice. The view is gorgeous too. You can see river canal and fish market and some old Portuguese houses.
I can't recommend it more.

We had such a delicious lunch that we returned for dinner-on the SAME day!!!  Service was amazing-such friendly staff, atmosphere lovely and the food was delicious!!!!  The fish was fresh and the "migas" terrifico-very different from other "migas" we have had

An absolute gem in Aveiro! Bar Adamastor stands out not only for its delicious seafood rice truly one of the best we‚Äôve had, rich in flavor and generously served but also for the exceptional hospitality.
The owner is incredibly welcoming and kind, making you feel more like a guest than a customer. His passion for good food and great service really shows.
If you‚Äôre in Aveiro, don‚Äôt miss this place a genuine experience of local warmth and great cooking.

The best thing about this place is the early opening hours. It's so good to find something open early morning in Portugal.
Coffee was good, sandwiches were huge, and tasty.
We also ordered the falafel salad, because we have a vegan in the group and it wasn't good. The falafel came out of the fridge without heating. You supposed to serve falafel hot. Wasn't tasty at all. It's so easy to put cheakpeas or heat falafel or be a bit more creative with vegan options.
The waitress was very nice, but service was slow due to nit enough staff and slow kitchen, with a full restaurant. It's a good option for breakfast if you are not vegan, and it's nice to sit there.

We came for cake after seeing all the nice photographs. Drove specifically for this place. Arriving the place was empty, there were only few slices left that sat on the sun. What shocked me though was the price. 5‚Ç¨ for a small piece of cake.
The woman working was kind and with a big smile.
One of the best‚Äôs pingado‚Äôs I had in Aveiro. Great coffee and delicious desserts!
The owner and his wife Burcin were so accommodating, kind, offered amazing homemade food, service, wifi- EVERYTHING otimo. Vegan food and caf√© was delicious, and I can't wait to come back!
It's a place with a wonderful atmosphere. Finding Turkish coffee in Portugal was such a pleasant surprise. I think it's definitely a lovely spot worth visiting.
Great cocktails and knowledgeable bartenders.  Large gin selection.   Even had some mezcal which has been hard to find.  Has an outdoor patio area as well.   The shrimp appetizer was very tasty.
Great bar, we didn't eat here but found it to be a very friendly place with good drinks at fair prices. Jo√£o was especially nice and so helpful. Definitely worth a visit.
Service is the best. Guy made us feel home and even had shots with us. Love this bar, definetly will come back
Ok, this is my spot!  Friendly staff, great drinks and nice atmosphere.  You have to  try their bruschetta's, TASTY! Also ask for the different dipping sauces for the wings.  Homemade and very good!
Very nice bar, pleasant, knowledgeable staff and great selection of drinks.

Really enjoyed the experience here. We ordered the usual couvert (bread, butter, and olives). Then we ordered the Chateaubriand with french fries and salad. Additionally, we ordered some vegetables saut√©ed. The chocolate mouse and cheesecake were fantastic! The food was great! What I did not like was the low wine options and overprices (some were about +3 times over the usual).
The food so tasty and service so friendly. If you looking for good quality steak. I Recomment here üëç
Food and service was extremely amazing! Joao was truly amazing and extremely helpful and gave great history and knowledge of all foods. The steaks were worth every penny. The deserts were fantastic.

This was 100 euro dry aged steak , 80% of it was fat and the rest was edible . Complete scam and do not recommend . Sent the steak back because when it came out the first time it was COLD on the inside . Dead giveaway that it was frozen and not dry aged . Really upset that this was the only bad experience i‚Äôve had in Portugal but won‚Äôt ever come back and will tell anyone i talk to that this place is a scam .

My wife and I had the best steak and dining experience of our lives at this place! The food was incredible, the wine was amazing, the atmosphere was cool, and the staff were incredibly kind and knowledgeable. If I ever get to go back to Portugal this is a must stop for me!!!

The place is neat and clean, looks very authentic and the service is perfect, very friendly girls. The food however was disappointing and not because it wasn‚Äôt well cooked or served, but you could feel that the quality of the ingredients is very low. We ordered the grilled cod fish and it was very dry and tasteless, exactly like a cheap frozen fish from the most random supermarket. The side dish and the plating were nice, so the issue was not from the chef, but, as mentioned, the quality of the ingredients. Therefore, not a great value for the price.
We had a very good time, we tasted dishes with strong flavours, but very good.In a familiar and attentive atmosphere. The sardines are excellent

I enjoyed a delightful dinner at Tasca do Confrade -- a very cozy restaurant in the center of Aveiro -- with a very friendly attention form the waiters. I ordered a very nicely cooked steak served with exquisite potatoes. I recommend it.

Stumbled on the restaurant by chance. After reading the reviews, it seems like a good place. Once entering the restaurant, it has a classic atmosphere.

The food we ordered were Seafood rice, mussles, grilled codfish.  All are insanely delicious. The mussles with tamato based sauce are so good. The mussles are huge.  The seafood rice is sooo yummy. The codfish is firm abd fresh.  For desserts, we ordered the "cream of heaven," and coffees. It is so delectable.  Overall, great service and memorable experience.

I had a fish(number2) which looks fancy but it doesn‚Äôt have any taste and later we discovered that it is not even fresh fish and my boyfriend had meat(number 7) and it was better than mine but it wasn‚Äôt the best nor deserve the price. I really don‚Äôt think they deserve the money they take for this food. Also they bring you entries without asking and then they charge you for that too. So you pay for cheese,olive and packaged butter 6 eu. If you can‚Äôt find anywhere to eat just go to mall so at least you can eat tasty and leave the table full.

worst apartments!
The picture on the booking and the reality do not match. The apartment is very old, it smells like a wet dirty rag. The whole apartment stinks, including the bed. The bathroom is moldy. The view from the window - forget it. There is a construction site under the windows that will be used instead of an alarm clock. And also a bar, the noise only stopped at 3 am.

these apartments are not worth 130 euros per night.
price/quality does not match

One of the worst nights of my life. The apartment is right over an extremely loud bar that blasted noise until 5am on a Monday. It was like trying to fall asleep inside of a bar. Me, My pregnant wife, and my 4 year old had a horrific time staying here.
Light and modern apartment with a wonderful hostess.
This is our second time staying here and we are delighted with everything, the owner, the place...we will definitely come back.
The food is homemade and delicious. Any type of cod you choose is a sure hit. The waiter is attentive and friendly. The price is also very good. Definitely a landmark in Aveiro. We'll be back.

Terrible! It looked cozy and it was busy. But don't be tempted. The food was mediocre from my table companions and my fish was raw and smelly. I think it was spoiled and I didn't dare eat it. The service did nothing with this remark. Not recommended!
The food is spectacular 10/10

There is a lot of good things to say about the place. Conveniently located in the center. Quick and nice service. A digital map / route - BUT - check your bike. Mine had a lose saddle which did not lock properly (noticed after 20 min) and a lose handlebar which nicked down after like 40 min (easily to lift up again but would not hold much). Safety is first. Get the bikes checked. Everytime. Except for that - Aveiro is nice to cycle around.

Amazing service! We rented two adult and two child-sized bike to ride along the salinas. The service was exceptional, very reasonably priced and extremely easy process. Bikes included helmet and locker and were quite good to ride. Would definitely come back and would recommend
Amazing place very well located .. excelent value for the money
Excellent apartment for rent a few days.

The sofa is very hard, in a state of change, very old, it can be made into a sofa bed but you don't have pillows or anything and a piece of wood stabs you in the back. The house is in terrible condition, it needs remodeling. Hygiene is not their strong point. Starting at 3 in the morning, the upstairs neighbor started hitting and shouting at the top of his lungs, they threw things on the floor and we couldn't sleep. Apart from that, the owner then told us that we wanted the money back for having given him a bad review on booking and the only thing we wanted was for it not to happen again. NOTHING RECOMMENDABLE, EVERYTHING IS TERRIBLE.

The mattress is truly HORRIBLE; it's very old and sunken in the middle. The furniture is old and neglected.
It has poor ventilation and the windows overlook an interior courtyard.
It's well located.
Nice clean place with tasty fried foods.  Inexpensive too. Muito bom!

The food is good, but this is not the place for a traditional Sunday meal anymore.

The bread was great, but the selection of butters doesn't work together. The taste of noisette was much too strong.

The seafood rice is easily recommendable and they are generous with the seafood, which is obviously fresh and delicious.

The service is hands down the best part of the experience. Our waitress did oversell the dishes a little bit, but I really appreciated their attentiveness and suggestions in terms of wine pairing.

Great and tasty food, with a nice atmosphere and friendly, knowledgeable staff. The waiting time for the dishes was a bit long, and the meat came out a little too rare. I guess that‚Äôs how they usually serve it. Overall, it was a good and tasty experience.

Tasting the foods we ordered is like having a mesmerizing trip along portugese coasts. It‚Äôs fresh, fishy, tasty.

Service is above of excellent - professional, friendly, attentive. They introduced the menus in details and give a great recommendation.

Lovely ambience and light decoration. We‚Äôre able seeing how the chefs are preparing the foods and showcasing their talents.

It‚Äôs a fantastic experience, i hope they would soon be listed as a michelin restaurant.

Amazing experience worth taking some time to post about. I was not expecting such a great service coupled with great food.
The waiters were very knowledgeable on the menu, wines and cocktails. They helped us navigate the different options and perfectly explained the preparation and appropriate pairings. Not even 5 minutes after we ordered we already had appetizers and bevrages on the table, and they constantly came over to make sure all our needs were covered even if the place was full.
The food was amazing, presentation and flavors. You can tell the quality of ingredients they use and how they innovate. The oven rice was amazing. The meat was soft, perfectly cooked and seasoned. The croquettes were unlike anything I've tried before and the shrimp empanadas were rich and flavorful.
I'm surprised this place hasn't made it to the Michelin guide even as a recomendation, hope they get their star soon.

We booked for a 7:30pm table, this avoided the rush later in the evening.
The staff were friendly and helpful with menu choices.
The drinks menu is limited and they don't deviate, which was disappointing.
We opted for a mix of dishes for the centre of the table, so our party could sample all the choices. This was a great shout and highly recommended.
The deserts were the only downside, and were a let down compared to the quality of the main dishes.
The six of us had a blast here, sat outside, ate seafood: grilled sardines were excellent, same with the seafood stew and sea bass. They have good wine.

The restaurant has a great atmosphere, great decoration inside and it‚Äôs close to the canal. However, we ordered meat and french fries - both were extremely salty. We are tourist, but not stupid. This games are well known...
Our group of 6 walked in with no reservations. Pedro was extremely accommodating and helped us with our order. Everything was fantastic.

Pretty nice cafe bar and restaurant at the picturesque city of Aveiro. Nice for coffee or tapas and good variety of wines, with beautiful view of the city canal. Beautiful decorated indoor seating, outdoor seating is also available. Nice for all times of day.
Great restaurant! They took us in last minute, right before closing, served us delicious food and didn‚Äôt rush us to finish :) Tasteful Dorada and sangr√≠a, great service!
Pandora and the boss Vittor are super stars ‚ú® we had waffles and ice cream and it was awesome. The price is very reasonable and above all their customer service was on top. ü´∂üèªüëèüèª
Small shop, little variety of flavors, good‚Äôish ice creams but there are better ones in town.
Fast and nice staff. Got a vanilla icecream and it was tasty. Good location.

Had a waffle and pancake.  Both were excellent. Really big with fresh fruits.
Good coffee as well.    And at a very reasonable price.
Soooo good! Ice cream and sorbet! We got the tiramisu, cheese cake with fruits, mango and passion fruit. ‚Ç¨3.90 for 2 scoops

Very rude staff. They deserve the comments. Great musical selection but the customer experience is non existant. Portuguese people are often kind. This people shouldn't run a store. I am a vinyl collector with hundreds of vinyl record stores visited. This is by far the worst experience

Even being fluent in Portuguese so doesn‚Äôt looks like a tourist or anything didn‚Äôt change how rude customers get treated by the staff. It‚Äôs sad that a store with such good products is managed by such negative persons‚Ä¶ Their mood are the total opposite of what you would expect from a music enthusiast :/
And also they seems to didn‚Äôt allow taking pictures inside the store, why not but in my opinion this is a complete nonsense in big 2024.

Don‚Äôt bother! The staff are rude and disrespectful. Spend your money elsewhere. My daughter was looking at Taylor Swift CD‚Äôs to buy and they were incredibly rude to her so we walked out! Won‚Äôt go back.

Worst music store I have ever been to. Went in to buy some vynil and owner in a very rude way wouldn't let me Shazam some Portugese song unless I buy it from him. Completely ruined my mood so I let this store immediately. Avoid this place at all cost.
They have some albums I would have bought but the owner is a psycho who chased me out of the store for taking a photo

Here, you can find small snacks and drinks at reasonable prices that are truly delicious. My tuna sandwich was truly impressive. The service, as is the case almost everywhere in Portugal, is extremely attentive and friendly. You sit outside in the bustling, narrow streets.

An excellent place to escape the tourist prices, as well as the expensive places for visitors.

They serve the same thing every day, with a homemade flavor and fast service!
Highly recommended for budget travelers!
A highly recommended traditional place to grab a bite to eat. Everything is delicious and the prices are more than reasonable. Mar√≠a is very friendly and approachable. A real success!

Super-delicious typical Portuguese dishes. At very reasonable prices.
The waiter is super friendly and helpful. A great way to escape the tourist bars and experience the true flavors of this place.

A typical Portuguese place with super attentive and friendly service, delicious food, and a great tuna sandwich! Delicious Francesinha and freshly made cod fritters! Highly recommended, reasonable price, I loved it! Very quaint!
Very cool little shop and you are only listed by your creativity. A wonderful stop

Had a very pleasant experience with the owner of the store and the ceramics lady Elinhas. Very friendly, kind people who clearly love what they do. Beautiful artwork, absolutely recommend anybody to come by :)

SUCH AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE. I absolutely loved the ceramics with Elinhas, and then the owner of the store and the lovely assistant were so helpful and kind. We got the most beautiful tiles as gifts for our families!! A must visit in Aveiro
Unique custom pieces that make great gifts! Ready in 20 minutes..friendly and helpful staff!

everything was perfect! nice owner and maestro in oneüòâfast ,professional service, low prices and great atmosphere.
Amazing souvenir for lifeüôÇ

Steaks were overcooked, the server got both the drinks and food orders wrong (not because of a language barrier as a family member who is local to the area ordered in Portuguese), and we were unable to use the bathroom as a member of staff was bathing, brushing their teeth, and doing their makeup in the entrance.
Just Wow!!! The food was realy good!!!

This butcher shop is located in the historic center of Aveiro. It goes almost unnoticed because it has no special windows or advertising. Friendly staff and good-quality products. Upon entering, there's a family atmosphere. Prices are average.
In the center of Aveiro. A butcher shop that offers some canned goods.
Wonderful place to eat like at grandma's house ‚ù§Ô∏è

I've given it one star because it forces me to. I made a reservation for April 2020 two months ago through Booking.com for 5 people (two apartments), and they confirmed it. Now the apartments are sending me a message saying they don't have the 3-person apartment available and telling me to cancel the reservation.
I feel scammed, deceived, and manipulated by the apartments and Booking.com, offering me alternatives that don't meet my expectations. It's a disgrace; in the end, the same people always lose out.

Ordered a sandwich and a Fanta for lunch. Was a big group and in total we ordered two sandwiches and to toast. It took some time to get our food and it was pretty simple sandwiches to make. They forgot to make one of the sandwiches wich was mine, so I did not get my food. After a long time we decided to not get them to make another. The staff did not talk english that well. Nice spot for lunch, but unlucky with the food.
Leitao tasted good, but a portion is quite small. Service was fast and friendly, allowing me to replace chips with salad. Quite touristic.

Stopped in earlier in day for drinks.  Other patron was very happy with their salad; we returned for dinner.
The suckling pig is delicious.  We ordered a plate of leitao and a sandwich with cheese. Both were delicious- we may be back!  Service was quick and friendly.  Recommend
The food was outrageously good. Suckling pig and roasted pork - absolutely delicious.

Review of Leit√£o de Levira

I tried their specialty ‚Äì a kind of sandwich with roast pork and homemade potato chips on the side. It was my first time tasting this type of dish, and I was pleasantly surprised ‚Äì the flavor was quite good. I chose the version with cheese, which had a slightly sharp taste, but it worked fine overall.

The chips I got at first were a bit soft, probably from sitting out too long. However, when the waiter came to check if everything was okay, I mentioned it, and he immediately brought out a fresh portion that was crispy and much better. Great service and an interesting food experience!

Horrible Experience - Deplorable Hotel I was very surprised to find that it was self-service, but I actually liked that aspect. However, my experience took a turn for the worse as soon as I walked through the door. The hotel was nothing like the pictures they had online, which felt like a FAKE ADVERTISEMENT. While the location was okay, both inside and outside the room were in a very poor condition. I won‚Äôt recommend this hotel to anyone. In fact, I ended up leaving and didn‚Äôt stay for the night. I won't recommend this hotel to anyone. Stay away!

We stayed with four people in a family room. The room was not as small as most of the reviews describe here. It had a new bathroom and we had a pleasant stay for two nights. You can eat a free small breakfast at a place nearby. Good value for money. You might want to bring earplugs, because the building is very noisy.

There was not anybody around, you are basically left by yourself and the number you can call does not provide an English speaker operator. As soon as you speak in English, they will hang up on you. We were supposed to receive breakfast but we did not, the heating would not work so we slept feeling cold for the whole night. It was january so the heating must have worked. The place was not dirty, but do not trust the pictures you see in booking sites because those are probably the ones of the suites, but not those of the usual bedrooms. The only positive aspect was its position which was central in Aveiro.

Horrible place. Don't go there. Pictures are very old and not accurate. There is no kitchen or commun area anymore. The building has been left in decay for a long time. Room was dirty with stains on the walls and on bed sheets that has clearly not been washed. Greasy floor. Shower barely working, water not draining, all rusted and dirty. This place should be closed.
Great location for ONE night. The rooms can be a bit hit and miss. My friends didn't have any trouble with the check in machine. Safe and secure right in the centre though.

Great lunch with coworkers! The place is a bit hidden, but the food is great! The staff was nice and kind to us, specially the owner üòÜ On the 2 visits, I ordered a pizza fritta and Rigattoni Alla Zozzona pasta, which were fantastic and tasty. For dessert, I ordered a Tiramisu, but, for the price, I think it should have a little more. In general, the prices are ok, and the wine list is good.
True napolitalian pizza and calzone . The owner it‚Äôs out of this world. you gotta love Italians . The service was fast and friendly. Price is very good between 6 and 13 euros for a pizza .
Pretty quick service and the servers are nice. We got the four cheese pizza which is really good especially if you like blue cheese. Portions are decent (the pizza can be for 2-3) people.

This was the best pizza I behave had in years!  We had the margharita, bufala and bolegnese pizzas along with an arugula and burrata salad. The salad was so fresh!  Pizza crust was perfect. The owner came to chat with us. He even is a professor who teaches chefs around the world how to make a proper pizza!  The service was wonderful as well. If you are in Aveiro, Portugal, you must visit!!! The pizza was so good , we forgot to take pictures!

We were here for the day vacationing and found this restaurant. The pizza we ordered was perfect size for the two of us to share. It was delicious and they were so kind. If I were in the area I would go and try other items on the menu.

I ended up in the pharmacy after being wounded while hiking. The staff gave advice on  pharmaceuticals and even allowed me go inside and heal myself. Thank you so much for the trust and kindness. This is not something you see every day.
They have saved my life. If this happens to me in Spain, I would die because the medication they gave me in Spain would mean I would have to go to the emergency room.

Decided to have lunch here, looked fine, sadly it was a disaster from start to finish food took 45 mins to come (burgers) all freezing cold , 2 out of 4 meals were simply inedible, waitress needs. Personality transplant not 1 smile no apology, used the toilet and wish I'd went before I ordered absolutely disgusting place , avoid
A zero star would be too much !!

Food was cold, cod was tasteless. We did not see even one smile from the waitresses. Location-wise the outdoors area was very noisy with tourists. Price did not meet the quality. Left hungry since could not eat even the soaked and softened potato chips around the fish.

Nice staff, however the food quality is really not great.  Frozen food that‚Äôs been deep fried and the rice was overcooked.  The tapas were all cold and kept under a heater for too long and again they really seemed to be from frozen supermarket.
Portion is small. The rice with fish is tasteless. Had to ask for salt and pepper, add them to the dish in order to finish it.
I waited for my food for 45 minutes, I think something happened, but the staff was very apologetic about it. The food was good but a small portion for the price in my opinion.
Best souvenir and gift shop in town!
Buy pot holders here, 7 euros each
A good place to shop for souvenirs. Service is good, but you have to be a little careful when moving around inside because everything is very close together due to the small store.

A BIG DECEPTION
Everything is very well thought out, the photographs, the information provided, etc. You don't realize what's going on until you get far enough away. And that's when you realize what they're really offering you is a shared apartment, full of lies.
Because it doesn't have a pool, a hair salon, or reception until 8 p.m., the rooms are very noisy, there's a lack of security, flimsy doors and locks, and no public parking.
In our experience, we were quite lucky with the people we shared with, a very nice couple from Madrid in the same situation as us.
As for the location and decor, they were very good, but the shower in the RV I rented two years ago was larger. Two of the three bedrooms were quite small and poorly ventilated, with no air conditioning, although it was necessary. The beds were very comfortable, but not enough to make up for all the negatives.
Honestly, I don't recommend it at all; there are better and much cheaper places.
All of this was brought to Booking.com's attention, and the most they got was a small financial compensation.

A very cozy place, clean and all the decoration is very cool. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was clean and very spacious. The apartment is in the heart of Aveiro, next to bars, souvenir shops, pastry shops, etc. The only thing is that it does not have parking, the car has to be left a little further away, but it is easily accessible, and I don't know how long it takes, 5/10 minutes walking more or less.

Sometimes you only discover a place after you leave. Casa do Caf√© located in the main square, many restaurants near by, tables are spread in the public area. We had a brunch and wanted to have a memory from this wonderful day. An aroma and flavor that could bring memories. This coffee reminds us that great day with every sip we take. ‚òï
We had a bad experience because we bought a coffee machine that it was broken and the seller didn‚Äôt wanted to change it or money back.
We picked up several different roasts while on vacation, and they have all been very good. I wish I could order some to be delivered here in Western Canada!
A variety of coffee blends to choose from, including their own Aveiro one, which is very nice. Definitely recommend.
I think the coffee beans they gave me weren‚Äôt freshly roasted unless they are supposed to be aroma-less and flavorless.

We were told by a waitress that they did not have any table left, yet 2 were freed up 10 seconds later and another waiter sat us down. They were out of all soft drinks and did not agree to serve tap water. Bacalhau √† Br√°s was exceedingly salty, making it barely edible. The other dishes were not great either unfortunately.

At 4pm we wanted a drink and try some cod.
There were only 2 tables occupied. We waited 30 minutes before a lazy waiter went to our table. He was yawing at our table with his mouth wide open.
Nothing i wanted to order was available anymore.
So we decided to just have a drink, one beer and one gin and tonic. Before we had our drinks, we had to wait doe another 15 minutes...
Just stay away from this place.

Just lovely and yummy. We popped in the other day with the four of us for dinner. I was starving and ordered a starter with bacalhau croquettes. They were simple and just perfect. We all a main dish, either a combination of flakes and potato and eggs and just yummy stuff, or the vegetarian dish with goat's cheese, or a chunk of bacalhau with perfect potatoes, onion, garlic and lovely taste. We all finished every last bit of it. I don't understand the negative comments here. This is a great place, good kitchen, excellent service... and I'd recommend to everyone!

Little gem. If you're trying to avoid tourist traps and overpriced cantina food: that's definitely the best spot in Aveiro. The entire menu is based on codfish, and if you like it, you won't be disappointed. The food is really fresh and tasty- I had the tasting platter (13‚Ç¨) so i could get a bit of every dish, and everything was delicious (really loved the cod, egg and chickpea salad though). Most of the other items on the menu are between 6 and 9 euros.  The staff was really kind and the service was fast. Would definitely recommend!

The worst bacalhau com nata I've tried!  It was burnt, dry and the flavor was not good at all.
The service was sooooooo slow!!  They only had two waitresses for all the tables... we waited more than an hour to get our food.   I don't recommend this place at all!

place_name: Socodante - Sociedade Comercial De Livros, Lda.
review_text:
Arrisco a dizer que deve estar entre uma das melhores lojas de papelaria especializada de Portugal. Um espa√ßo pequeno mas muito acolhedor e bem organizado, para quem gosta de canetas, lapiseiras, rollers, esferogr√°ficas, e respetivos acess√≥rios, tudo no contexto de um excelente design e de marcas internacionais - esta √© uma "must visit". A Socodante tem tradi√ß√£o em Aveiro, de muitas d√©cadas, com o mesmo esp√≠rito, linha de produtos e atendimento profundamente humanizante e de algu√©m que tamb√©m tem muito gosto nos artigos, absolutamente soberbos que tem √† venda. Recomendo que visitem a Socodante e fica o desafio para indicarem se conseguem l√° n√£o-voltar :-)
............................
I dare say that it must be among one of the best specialized stationery stores in Portugal. A small but very welcoming and well-organized space, for those who like pens, mechanical pencils, rollers, ballpoint pens, and their accessories, all in the context of excellent design and international brands - this is a "must visit". Socodante has a tradition in Aveiro, going back many decades, with the same spirit, product line and deeply humanizing service - of someone who also has a lot of taste in the absolutely superb items that are for sale. I recommend that you visit Socodante and drop a line here if you manage not to go back there :-)
Well located and great hosts.

The apartment is very pretty, bohemian, and spacious. It's right in the middle of the old town and is bright and charming. It has a playroom for the kids and the kitchen is gorgeous and huge. The guy who helped us was very polite and helpful. We loved it.
Excellent location, with all the amenities, spaciousness, comfort, and good taste. Also highly recommended is its strategic location and personalized service.

We stumbled upon this place early on the morning of our day trip to Aviero. It was one of the few places open early in the morning. We were happy we found it. Great place to stop for breakfast. The portions were more than adequate and the price could not be beat. It was a great breakfast. The hot chocolate was also very delicious.
Really tasty ice cream with plenty of options, maybe even too many, it is hard to decide what to choose!

A very relaxing place to chill and have coffee - got ourselves some mocha and pastel de nata to share while waiting for our lunch spot to open at 12pm.

Mocha was alright, they serve it with the chocolate, milk and coffee separately which was quite interesting. Pastel de Nata was okay, not the best I had and one of the more pricey ones at ‚Ç¨1.50.
Tasty ice cream. Lot of flavours to choose.

Top place for a coffee and breakfast. It was close to our accommodation, so the first day we stopped for a coffee and some snacks. Since food and service were so good, we spent here all 3 days of our vacation enjoying breakfast, ice cream, and coffee.
I can recommend any ice cream, toast, and granola for breakfast.

We had Grilled Squids, prawns dish and steak with mushroom sauce. It was so yummy.  Staff were very friendly. They let us sat at their place for a while as we were finishing our game.
Absolutely enjoyed our time.
What an amazing place to grab a bite to eat in Aveiro. Beautiful cod cooked in a multitude of ways. Absolutely delicious! Great wine, lovely atmosphere and fantastic service!

Very hospitable restaurant. They respond to the child's wishes with great understanding. The food is perfectly prepared and delicious. You can see into the kitchen when you come in. It is very clean and well maintained. I can only recommend sitting here and will come back when I visit the place again. Thank you all! ‚ù§Ô∏è

October 2025.  Stopped in Aveiro on drive between Lisbon and Porto.  Super super cute town.  We popped in here for lunch, and had a great time.  Good food and wine.  Place seems very local/authentic.  We recommend this place.

The first item we ordered wasn‚Äôt available, the second item we ordered was not available. The service was good, the staff friendly. I must say I find dry rice a bit boring, but it appears a normal Portuguese thing. The chocolate mouse for dessert was nice, the tip the waiter gave to add a wee bit of salt was great. The price was very reasonable. We didn‚Äôt have to wait long at all as it was no longer the busy season.

Great location, nice apartment, about 2 minutes from one of the best pizza shops in Portugal and Tram 28.
Walkable to major attractions.
The location is perfect, everything is the same as in the photo, it is a very nice room and its decoration is careful
Top

First time in Aveiro and we made the right choice. The accommodation is right in the center, everything is within easy reach. Very nice, although old-fashioned. If I had to mention a negative point, it would be that they don't have central heating, but they do have air conditioning (so we slept well) and they provide an old radiator for the bathroom...

The location is good, on a quiet street despite being right in the city center. The room is comfortable except for a step at the entrance to the bathroom and the stairs leading up to it. Plenty of kitchenware.

Nice place for a few snacks and drinks.  We wanted white Sangaria, but we were told our only options were red or sparkling.  We settled for red, which unfortunately was not that great.  If lacked brandy and only had apple and orange for fruit.  Some of the apple pieces were cut too big, and the orange pieces were way too old. The French fries were very good though.

Picked this place randomly for lunch. Great value for reasonable prices. We had the shrimps with herbs and garlic and it was delicious and well made. Only my mother can make better shrimps. Strongly recommended stop if you‚Äôre ever in Aveiro.
Nice music, good food and lovely staff! Ronny was very friendly helping us with the menu :)
Very good food and service!  My waiter was Ronny, super kind and attentiveüëçüèª

Goat stew was delicious.
Ronnie was a very good host!
Not bad at all if you like tea. Nice costumer service, well designed products.
Great place to buy tea, too bad it's closed now.

An unforgettable stay! From the location to the impeccable cleanliness, Casa da Mar√© exceeded all expectations. We stayed with our baby, and the host's attention to detail was remarkable, ensuring every comfort was met. We‚Äôll definitely come back. 10/10

Amazing location and great conditions.  Super clean!
The house is very cozy and well decorated, fully accessorized. We stayed with a couple friend and  were only a couple minutes walking from literally everywhere. Highly recommended! Definetely coming back.
Loved our stay at Casa da Mar√©! Best option in the area.
I asked him to fix the hook on my glasses' temples. He was very attentive and friendly, and he didn't want to charge me anything. He left my glasses better than they were before!

Great... the gentleman was super attentive and very competent... I bought a ring and earrings... I'm very happy.
You can tell they're very professional.

place_name: Aveiro no Cora√ß√£o - Passeios de Barco
review_text:
Taking a moliceiro tour is definitely one of the must-do experiences in Aveiro.

Gliding through the canals on those colorful boats is fun and gives you a nice feel for the city‚Äôs charm.

I‚Äôm only docking one star because our guide seemed a bit inexperienced ‚Äî we got the basic history about Aveiro‚Äôs salt trade and its famous sweet ovos moles, but not much beyond that.

Maybe the guide was just new, or maybe Aveiro itself doesn‚Äôt have much to talk about ‚Äî hard to tell!

That said, at around ‚Ç¨15 per person, it‚Äôs still absolutely worth doing.

If you can, request an older or more seasoned guide for a richer experience.

I only had one day in Aveiro, and while it‚Äôs often called the ‚ÄúVenice of Portugal,‚Äù I personally found it a bit quiet compared to other Portuguese cities.

Still, the canals and moliceiros are unique and make for great photos.

place_name: Aveiro no Cora√ß√£o - Passeios de Barco
review_text: We have done this boat tour 2 times now and each time we learned something new and the hosts are very friendly very knowledgeable and professional! We even loved our little gifts at the end :) thank you can‚Äôt wait to go again‚Ä¶

place_name: Aveiro no Cora√ß√£o - Passeios de Barco
review_text: Boat tour was fun. Would be better with a smaller group.. it was hard to hear the guide on the microphone.

place_name: Aveiro no Cora√ß√£o - Passeios de Barco
review_text: This a great stop from Lisbon to Porto. We floated down the canals and learn more about the history of the town and the people.

place_name: Aveiro no Cora√ß√£o - Passeios de Barco
review_text: We had a great time on the boat tour, the stories about the town and old-time pictures to go along with it are inspiring and funny. We lucked out with the last boat of the day and this boat tour really made out trip to Aveiro. Highly recommend!

Fabulous! Food and service very good, large portion sizes and very cheap!

We had spring rolls (they‚Äôre big!) followed by chicken sweet & sour and pork chow mein. It was all hot, very tasty and plenty of it.

Staff are lovely, menus are in English.

It was quite busy and we had a great time.

Recommended.

The spring rolls are amazing! We ordered another one because it was so good. It‚Äôs super crispy on the outside and the inside is filled with lots of vegetables. The sweet and sour pork and noodles were good as well. The staff were very polite and nice. The prices are very cheap. I would eat here again.
Unexpectedly nice Chinese food place in Aveiro üòä Fast service, good quality/price ratio. Dark authentic atmosphere. Big portions, and everything is super tasty. Recommend to visit!
Nice location, great for individual or group dining. Service was great and food was pretty good. Some items were better than others! Prices were great!

Authentic Chinese Restaurant in Aveiro
Dark atmosphere The spicy sour soup was just sour, not spicy at all‚Ä¶ Pekin Duck was okay. There was salt üßÇ on the table! We wanted to try few more things, asked for recommendations but there was a language barrier(No English) so we gave up.The menu is very large and the service was good.

Only my second visit. A great place to buy electronics parts and tools. I only needed some lead/tin solder 60/40. Even though my Portuguese is limited, I did know that lead was chumbo. I came out with 250grams of good quality solder at a very reasonable price.
The service was OK but kind of slow and old fashioned.
Good vibes, professional staff.
Good service and plenty of electronics.
Top
Marlene is an excellent professional. I strongly recommend her. If you are in Aveiro and need to have your nails done,  Bem Me Quer nails is the place!
I came for a last minute manicure. I'm from U.S.  VERY.well done and quick!  Obrigado!

We had a great stay at Hotel Aveiro Centre - a 3 star hotel which shares facilities with its 4 star neighbour. The room was comfortable, and breakfast was delicious! It's a nice spot to stay in Aveiro - our room looked out to the canal and it was lovely for people watching. There was construction taking place in the reception area during our stay, but it did not impact us  (they were mindful about noise during morning/evening hours). The only small consideration is that the hallways are noisy (with other guests talking and shutting doors), so if you are sensitive to this it may be useful to know.

Cute hotel, like 12 minutes walk from a shopping place, close to the beautiful channel and colorful bridges.
For people who eventually need just one night or two,and they travel all day and just returning to sleep and shower- this will be a suitable good option here:)
Breakfast included!! so cute, so nice:)
Located in centre of aveiro, rooms were a good size and clean and tidy. Service was good. Breakfast was OK but not much hot food options hence one star off.

The rooms are clean, charming and the building is traditional but very well renovated. What a pleasant surprise. The breakfast was filled with fresh pastries and foods, including Extra virgin Olive oil, fruits, eggs and fresh honey with honeycombs.

Will be coming back when staying in Aveiro in the future.

Also a good note to the staff that was very friendly all along!
Very nice and clean, receptionist was incredible friendly and gave us a lot of informations, breakfast was very good. I recommend.
This is a excellent local authentic restaurant that everyone should try. Step away from the busy downtown for this great meal. We hand the monk fish and prawns.
The best cod I've ever eaten. An authentic place with Portuguese cuisine that I can highly recommend. Try it and you will be amazed!
The best food I‚Äôve tried here in Portugal üòç Authentic homemade dishes and nice service üëç Sincerely recommend to visit üòç
Monkfish rice with prawns was so heartwarming. Very fresh. Owner is very friendly as well.

Stumbled across this restaurant at around 1pm and decided to go there for lunch. They had a good lunch menu with a variety of 5 dishes (meat and fish).
Only Portuguese people, most of them looked like they were on their lunch break. Food was great and very fast service for a great price. Very good value for money. Seemed like a place that many locals go to. Highly recommend.

Rooms were very clean. Beds comfortable. Bathroom was very clean and with lots of space. Huge shower. We stayed here just one night and even we didn't use kitchen, it seem to be well equipped.  Things to improve: really missing little night light next to bed and in the kitchen would be nice to have little sofa. Big advantage is the location: very close to the center that you can reach just by walking 10 mins, but area is calm. Was quiet at night so we had a good rest.
Top

I rented an apartment with two single beds, maybe two 90cm beds if that. The room was clean. The kitchen was oversized; why would you need two blenders if there wasn't even a coffee maker? There were no amenities for guests, not even a bottle of water. There was a TV in the kitchen, but no sofa to relax on. There were no individual reading lights in the bedroom. A disaster. I can't even comment on the service, because it was nonexistent. The location was good, but that's about it. Parking was difficult. I wouldn't go back for anything.

Spacious rooms. Everything very clean. Kitchen equipped with oven, microwave, dishwasher, washing machine. The only negative thing was that they rang the bell from the street door several times in the early morning.
The perfect address for a stay in Aveiro, we are close to everything on foot.

place_name: Arrochela by Home Sweet Home Aveiro Apartments
review_text: Great experience staying a couple of nights here and great advice and service from the landlord Jorge. It‚Äôs right by the river and we could park the car really close. This place is a keeper!!

place_name: Arrochela by Home Sweet Home Aveiro Apartments
review_text:
The apartment is very well located, near Aveiro's central canal, within walking distance of everything. We didn't move our car during our entire stay. The owner showed us a secure, free parking area and let us use two bicycles, although all the areas of interest are within walking distance.
It's a very large apartment with two bedrooms, a bathroom, and a toilet. The best thing is the living-dining-kitchen area, very spacious and comfortable. It has a covered patio with an enclosed relaxation area.
The owner was very attentive and pleasant. He welcomed us with refreshments, gave us information about the surrounding area, and offered assistance whenever we needed it.
Highly recommended. Ideal for families and groups of friends.

place_name: Arrochela by Home Sweet Home Aveiro Apartments
review_text: Great location for exploring Aveiro. Quiet area. Well-equipped apartment.

Although no parking at the property, there is within an easy reach free parking, so no issues there, the property itself exceed my expectations, very well furnished, from the lounge to the kitchen and bedrooms, plenty channels to choose from, very clean house and the hosts were a delight to deal with, right in the city centre, will be back, definitely will be back.
Just one word. Fabulous

Very well-located accommodation in the heart of Aveiro. Free parking is a 5-minute walk away, as it's impossible to park in the city.
On each floor, there's a double room and a single room with a shower and toilet. The bedding is very good.
The host is very helpful and offers good advice.

The only downside is the damp smell in the main room. Very unpleasant in the morning when you go downstairs.

The house is very nice. It's right in the city center and has been very well renovated, but it has insect problems (ants and even a centipede), and the floor creaks so much that it wakes the whole family if you have to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night. They could replace the clothesline and put in a new one; it's in a terrible state and a new one doesn't cost much.

Very friendly welcome!!! Carmen and Zita take great care of their guests. Fruit basket for our arrival, advice on places to see and activities to do in the surrounding area. Perfect location if you want to go out for a drink in the evening, the most popular bars are just a stone's throw away, excellent location in the city centers, Carmen will tell you where the most convenient parking is if you come by car. I highly recommend this apartment where you feel right at home!!
Very tasty tripa (a type of cr√™pe) and bolachas americanas (thin crispy waffles) quickly to hand.

Best surf school that I have been to! Had a private class with Angelo, together with my friend. He was super honest about the weather conditions and feasibility of surfing. We got so many tips, instructions and personal attention. But the end of the class I was able to catch the waves myself. Would totally recommend, worth your money!

I had a class with Angelo yesterday, May 29. He was extremely transparent about the water and wind conditions, so we were very aware of the difficulties before agreeing to the class. He did not push a sale at all! The wetsuits we got were in perfect condition, ad were the boards. He was very attentive, giving amazing instructions and caring all around. Even though I got tired pretty fast, we had an amazing time! I recommend this school for sure, you will be in good hands!

My favourite local clothing brand. Everything what a surfer wantsüòçheart-warming owners and super friendly helping staff!!!if you are looking for a surf school than you are here at the right spot!!!!
local clothing brand associated with surf school. we recommend!
Best surf shop around! üëç

For my holidays I rented a car in Aveiro for 8 days and dropped it later in Lisbon Gare do Oriente. I took the premium package, since the cost was still very reasonable and I did not want any hassle. Eventually this was not really necessary but I still would do so. The car was very clean and in a perfect condition. Handover at pick up and drop off was simple and friendly. Overall a very positive experience.
Very happy with rental process. Staff in Aveiro was excellent.

Excellent customer service from Tatiana - she was the only person working at the Aveiro branch on the day and dealt perfectly with some unhappy customers in the queue ahead of me. She dealt with everything with professionalism and a smile. She was efficient helpful and not pushy - first class - thank you - a great credit to Europcar and they are lucky to have an employee like her!

One month after my complaint emails, I am still waiting for the compensation suggestion i was told 3 times i was entitled to due to the horrible experience we had‚Ä¶. Such ridiculous behavior from such ...

They keep saying to get in touch with their customer service but then never get back to me‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. Embarassing

Our car rented in Lisbon had a flat tyre in Averio. We went to the shop to ask for assistance. The staff was unhelpful and refused to call Europcar assistance hotline for us despite our repeated requests. It took us 3 hours to settle the case and got a taxi to Porto to get another car.
Best vegan food I had in aveiro so far. Just found portions a bit small since the food is realy good. A little bit more would be good.

Pad Thai was great and so was the service.  Many gluten free options as well as vegan options.
Restaurant and bathrooms were very clean and well decorated.  Will eat there again.

I have dreamed of a brunch like this, and today I had it. :')
Absolute perfection.
The salmon was not too salty, the scrambled eggs were fluffy, the avocado was ripe, fresh and generously served, the smoothies were tasty and the pancakes and brownie were soft and not excessively sweet.
Beautiful ambience and attention to detail ‚ô•Ô∏è
And a reasonable price for quality. Highly recommend üòä

Green Point is a hidden treasure in Aveiro!
Delicious mostly vegetarian food.
Smoked salmon toast and tofu pad Thai were outstanding. As was the veggie burger, one of the tastiest and most convincing non meat burger I have tried.
There is truly something for everyone here.
The service is friendly and on point and the atmosphere is casual and comfortable.
If you want some healthy comfort food in Aveiro, this is the place!

We went for dinner here and had delicious gluten free food!
The cook was so nice and explained everything. The waiter was not so informed but nice.
Its a bit more pricey but worth it!

place_name: Est√∫dio S by PT Susana Russo
review_text: Susanna is wonderful.  So knowledgeable and kind.  Yet she's always pushing to make you stronger and healthier.  Highly, highly recommend.
I'm giving it 5 stars because I can't give it 10. A huge thank you to Patricia, she was really helpful and solved the problem I had 100%.

Jos√© Pereira de Melo has represented us as a real estate attorney on two property purchases and we have been very satisfied. He is knowledgeable, personable and kept us informed at every step of the process. In fact, he went above and beyond what we expected, understanding our needs and difficulties as expats. He is fluent in English and even had contracts translated so that we could comprehend what we were signing. We have discovered that it is very important to have someone you can trust in real estate transactions and Jos√© at Atlantic Legal is that person.

Jos√© was the right person for the job. Buying a house in Portugal must be done with a lawyer a good one a really great one. He helped us with everything we asked for and more. I recommend him and he will be our lawyer for future endeavours..thank you for all what you did..

I recently relocated from New York to Portugal and I don‚Äôt think I could‚Äôve done it without the legal services and support of Atlantic Legal. I was guided step by step through the entire process with unending support and precise, clear, communication. Mr.Jose Pereira de Melo was attentive to my every need in the process of purchasing a property in Portugal as well as guiding me through the visa requirements with attention to detail. Communication was never lacking. I highly recommend Atlantic Legal and honestly, I can‚Äôt imagine anyone else doing a better job!

I received first class advice and service from Jo on a matter involving UK and Portuguese assets and advice. His knowledge and professionalism are second to none and his ability to advise and obtain advice cross different jurisdictions and bring it all together was of particular note. He also kept me well updated on fees which were very reasonable. I would not hesitate to recommend and will be using his services again.
Jose has helped my family to buy flat in Aveiro. He and his associates made great job and help went throughout the process without any issues. I would like to recommend him and Atlantic Legal.
Drove 20 minutes to use the laundromat and they have a sign on the door saying they're on vacation. They didn't update Google so one more day with the same clothes until I find another place.

Perfect place to wash everything! Light and clean place with all the luxury you need: folding-tables, coffee- and Snack-maschine and even kids-play-area! The place runs on solar panels and the owner was super friendly. All systems are translated into English. German and Russian translations are soon to come.
Clean, activities for children, nice owners, television. Chairs aren't terribly comfortable, but luckily washers and dryers are quick so you're done in less than an hour.
Beautifully designed space with a great choice of materials. Very cosy, agreeable and comfortable while waiting. There are even books! The washing and drying machines are superb.

Best in Portugal , love the 5 mnts extra for dryer (but it would be better if like Belgium dryers were on 10mnts periods ,so u can choose 20 or 30 mnts)
I've been in different laundries in 10 cities from Lagos to here and it's the best one so far

place_name: TC.Tattoo.Ink - Estudio de Tatuagens e Piercings
review_text:
What an excellent experience and a truly wonderful tattoo.

Tiago was very engaging, enthusiastic, friendly, welcoming and he's completely professional and an accomplished artist.

I'm very, very happy with my tattoo and I'd love to return and have more.

place_name: TC.Tattoo.Ink - Estudio de Tatuagens e Piercings
review_text: Very friendly.  Can not have a better experience..
Poor architectural choices and lack of civic sense

We visited Novobanco downtown Aveiro to transfer our address after our move here. Even though we had an appointment we were left waiting without anybody paying attention. After we asked about the reason we were told that many of the staff called in sick. Finally a very friendly lady, Ana Delgado, took care of us and helped with our problems. Our appointment was for 9:15 am. Around 10 am the bank office was packed with about 20 people waiting to be served.
I was also been there , i was get very excellent service .all staff are very friendly & helpful

I was go there 3 days continue, everyday I‚Äôve to wait there for 3-4 hours to be attended but not get solution of my service.
Very bad service
Very very very very very badly they attend clients .
üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°

This small hexagonal chapel, built in 1714, is a blend of Baroque and Mannerist architectural styles and was constructed to honor S√£o Gon√ßalinho, the patron saint of local fishermen. It is best known for the unique cavacas (traditional hard biscuits) throwing festival held every January. During the event, participants toss cavacas from the walkway next to the chapel down to the crowd below‚Äîa joyful and symbolic tradition that blends religious devotion with community celebration.
Went to catch some "Cavacas" which are a traditional pastry and they are thrown down the chappel. Its a traditional costume in that chappel near day 12 of January.
Great fun dropping the cavacas wouldn't be allowed in England Health and Safety LOL
Great street party ...

place_name: Restaurante Palhu√ßa ‚Äì Gastronomia Portuguesa em Aveiro
review_text:
Palhuca Restaurant in Aveiro offers a delightful culinary experience with a menu that showcases the rich flavors of the region. The food was exceptional, with each dish beautifully prepared and full of authentic Portuguese taste. The restaurant was bustling with locals, which added a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere, hinting at its popularity among those who know good food in the area.

However, our experience was marred by an unexpected issue with the bill. We were surprised to find a 20% tip automatically added to our bill, written only in Portuguese. This charge was not communicated to us beforehand, and it left us feeling somewhat taken advantage of. It gave the impression that this practice might not be applied to locals, raising questions about fairness and transparency. While we enjoyed the meal, this incident dampened our overall experience, and we left feeling a bit used. We hope the restaurant can address this issue to ensure a more transparent and inclusive experience for all patrons.

We would left 20% tip easily for the climate and great food‚Ä¶

place_name: Restaurante Palhu√ßa ‚Äì Gastronomia Portuguesa em Aveiro
review_text: A really great place to enjoy local food like Aveiro's eel specialties, for a reasonable price.

place_name: Restaurante Palhu√ßa ‚Äì Gastronomia Portuguesa em Aveiro
review_text: Palhuca in Aveiro offers great food and a lively atmosphere with plenty of locals. However, we were surprised by a 20% tip added without notice, written only in Portuguese. It felt a bit unfair, as locals might not face the same charge. Also, they were unexpectedly closed yesterday despite Google Maps showing them as open. Great meal, but they need better transparency and communication.

place_name: Restaurante Palhu√ßa ‚Äì Gastronomia Portuguesa em Aveiro
review_text: Authentic Portuguese restaurant visited by locals and people who know. Tasty seafood dishes, served by friendly hosts. We had a monk fish stew dish that could feed four people

place_name: Restaurante Palhu√ßa ‚Äì Gastronomia Portuguesa em Aveiro
review_text: Fun place to go in Aveiro. Yes - it is authentic and family owned. Fairly priced! Yep, service can seem unfriendly, but not THAT of a big deal either. The young man was actually very attentive. I have to be honest tho, the sardines could be too salty for most people, but the salad kinda lacked taste. Portions are great too! However it was a fun experience and I recommend going for dinner or lunch. Thanks!

1‚Ä¶ Our super special hostess‚Ä¶ Maiara was the BEST.  From her telling about the menu‚Ä¶ specials‚Ä¶ everything!! She was amazing!! The food!??!? Delicious!! There was 5 of us.. we all loved our food!! Definitely recommend
This is a very good restaurant. Staff people are very nice, food is amazing, and prices are excellent with respect to the quality of the food. Five stars!

It's pretty easy restaurant!
Nice Simple food with drinks bar!
Very comfortable relaxing with friends and family!
Very relaxed atmosphere. Upstairs and downstairs. Ate codfish with cream. Tried a drink which never had, called St Louis Framboise beer from Belgium. Situated on a quite road so look for it.

The owners were lovely, and so welcoming! We had the seafood rice for two, which was delicious, full of fresh seafood and generously portioned. Would highly recommend and we will come back the next time we are in the area!

Casa Pina Metal Bar in Aveiro offers not only a fantastic atmosphere but also a community of genuinely friendly people. From the moment you step in, you're embraced by the energetic vibe of the metal scene and welcomed by the warm staff. Highly recommended for an epic night out!

A really good place if you are into metal / rock / heavy scene and a good place to drink even if you are not into one of those scenes because the place is cool and you can have a sit and drink in a place where young and not so young converge.  Definetly your place if you like headbanger music!!!

very nice underground cozy place, where you can listen underground music, a place that can makes difference in Aveiro, the staff ia great and the prices of drinks are okay.
check it out.
This is the right place for rockers in the hood. A great variety of shots with cheap prices. Recommend Fudido ;)
This place is the best metal bar I've ever been into, at first sight you might not think that but the people the music and the environment around it worth way more than cash.

The croissants here were amazing. We tried the ovos moles but didn‚Äôt like them. Not that they were bad, I‚Äôm sure others enjoy them, but they just weren‚Äôt for us. The riss√≥is de camar√£o were pretty decent as well. The croissants were definitely the star. The owner or manager seemed like a really nice gentleman too.

Many pastry and baked good choices.  They'll looked delicious, and the ones we tasted were delicious.  The coffee is very good too.  Service is prompt and friendly. The place seems to be crowded all the time. Very nice and pleasant atmosphere.

Confeitaria Ramos is one of Aveiro‚Äôs most iconic and beloved pastry shops, steeped in history and tradition. Established generations ago, this family-run establishment has managed to preserve its original charm and authenticity over the years. Located in the heart of Aveiro, it is well-known for offering some of the finest traditional Portuguese pastries, making it a must-visit for anyone exploring the city.

What sets Confeitaria Ramos apart is its dedication to preserving recipes that have been passed down through the family. Their range of pastries includes Aveiro‚Äôs local specialties, with the famous "ovos moles" being a highlight. These delicate sweets, made from egg yolks and sugar, are wrapped in thin wafers and are a staple of the region. The quality of ingredients and the care put into every pastry is evident, resulting in a delightful and authentic culinary experience.

The shop itself exudes a warm and inviting atmosphere, with friendly staff who are always eager to share the history behind their creations. Whether you‚Äôre enjoying a quick coffee with a pastel de nata or savoring their regional specialties, Confeitaria Ramos offers a taste of Aveiro's rich confectionery heritage that has stood the test of time.
So good! We stumbled on this establishment and wish we had days to visit often. We enjoyed a variety of baked goods and they were all amazing, even holding up until the next day.

Liked the inside of the place, very old and has a traditional vibe. Also, the variety of options is quite wide for sweets as well as for baked goods. However, when we chose the seat it seemed like nobody cared about our presence. We spent more than 10min just to ask for a coffee. There was only one waitress serving almost everyone inside(although there were other waitresses who were chill and not busy at all) and was very busy although the place was only half full. Of course, the way we were served couldn't be friendly in this kind of situation. This cafe definitely needs some improvements in their service.
